inconcessus: <entryFree id="n22480" type="main" key="inconcessus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-concessus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22480.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not allowed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impossible</hi> (not ante-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">hymenaei,</quote> <trans><tr>unlawful</tr>, <tr>forbidden</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:651" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 651</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:638" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 638</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum totum exprimere paene sit homini inconcessum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inconcilio: <entryFree id="n22481" type="main" key="inconci^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-concĭlĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n22481.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to win over to one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s side</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to gain over artfully</hi> (anteand post-class.). </sense><sense id="n22481.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: inconciliasti, comparasti, commendasti, vel ut antiqui, per dolum decepisti, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=107" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 107</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">inconciliastin' eum, qui mandatu'st tibi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 99</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 1, 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille quod in se fuit accuratum habuit, quod posset mali faceret in me, inconciliaret copias omnis meas,</quote> <trans><tr>has done his best to injure me</tr>, <tr>to win over by trickery all my resources</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 22</bibl></cit> (cf. Brix ad Trin. l. l.). — Hence, </sense><sense id="n22481.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to embarrass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inveigle into difficulties</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make trouble for one</hi> (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">ne inconciliare quid nos porro postules,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 85</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: et me haud par est (sc. hunc ludificare). <hi rend="ital">To.</hi> Credo, quia . . . non inconciliat, quom te emo, <hi rend="ital">intrigued</hi>, <hi rend="ital">made difficulties</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inconcinne: <entryFree id="n22482" type="main" key="inconcinne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inconcinnē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. inconcinnus <sense id="n22482.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inconcinnitas: <entryFree id="n22483" type="main" key="inconcinni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inconcinnĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inconcinnus</etym>, <sense id="n22483.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inelegance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">awkwardness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impropriety</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">vitatis sententiarum ineptiis atque inconcinnitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:86" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2</bibl>, pp. 14, 21.</sense></entryFree>
inconcinniter: <entryFree id="n22484" type="main" key="inconcinni^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inconcinnĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. inconcinnus <sense id="n22484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inconcinnus: <entryFree id="n22485" type="main" key="inconcinnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-concinnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22485.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inelegant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">awkward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">absurd</hi> (rare but class.): qui in aliquo genere inconcinnus aut multus est, is ineptus dicitur, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 4, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">personamque feret non inconcinnus utramque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asperitas agrestis et inconcinna gravisque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18, 6</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> in two forms (in both post-class.), <hi rend="ital">awkwardly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">absurdly.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22485.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">inconcinnē</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">causificare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 242, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22485.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">incon-cinnĭter</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">vertere in aliquam rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:17:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 17, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inconcretus: <entryFree id="n22486" type="main" key="inconcre_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-concrētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22486.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bodiless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incorporeal</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">substantia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nazar.</author> Pan. Const. 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inconculcabilis: <entryFree id="n22487" type="main" key="inconculca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inconculcābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2 in-conculco</etym>, <sense id="n22487.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not capable of being trodden under foot</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Fulg. Rusp. Incarn. Filii, 50.</sense></entryFree>
inconcusse: <entryFree id="n22488" type="main" key="inconcusse_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inconcussē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. inconcussus <sense id="n22488.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inconcussus: <entryFree id="n22489" type="main" key="inconcussus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-concussus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22489.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unshaken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undisturbed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">firm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">constant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unchanged</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n22489.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelestia sidera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:268" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 268</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vestigia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 248</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22489.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">inconcussus ipse et immotus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:82:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 82, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inconcussus injuriā, Sen. de Ira, 3, 25: certaminibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">florebant hilares inconcussique Penates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:142" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 67" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 67 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">inconcussē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">firmly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resolutely</hi>, Cod. Th. 11, 61, 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Retract. 1:11" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Retract. 1, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incondemnatus: <entryFree id="n22490" type="hapax" key="incondemna_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-condemnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22490.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">uncondemned</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:24:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 24, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incondite: <entryFree id="n22491" type="main" key="incondi^te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incondĭtē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, see the foll. art. <sense id="n22491.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> <cb n="INCO" /></sense></entryFree>
inconditus: <entryFree id="n22492" type="main" key="incondi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incondĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n22492.0" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to condo, I.) <hi rend="ital">Not made</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncreated</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid innatum et inconditum praeter solum deum crederemus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Hermog. 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22492.1" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to condo, II.) </sense><sense id="n22492.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Not stored up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 5, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:1" default="NO">3, 2, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22492.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Without order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irregular</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disordered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confused</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unformed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncouth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rude</hi> (the class. signif. of the word): inconditum non ordinate compositum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=107" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 107</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">acies, with inordinata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:39:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 39, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">agmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordo ramorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 30, 53, § 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbidusque clamor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus civile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:44:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 44, 197</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:69:242" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 69, 242</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi consuetudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:44:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 44, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententias inconditis verbis efferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:44:150" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 44, 150</bibl></cit>: carmina, <hi rend="ital">artless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rude soldiers</hi>' <hi rend="ital">songs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 20, 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi haec incondita solus ... jactabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter jocos militares, quos inconditos jaciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:49:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 49, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:47:4" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 47, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 13, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si alicujus inconditi arripias dissipatam aliquam sententiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:70:233" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 70, 233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>not accustomed to military fatigue</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbanitas, in qua nihil inconditum possit deprehendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:107" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 107</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Syphax inconditae barbariae rex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 28, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nova atque incondita libertas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 24, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22492.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Unburied</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per patris cineres, qui inconditi sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3 praef" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 3 praef.</bibl></cit> § 7.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-condĭtē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">confusedly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:3:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 3, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:71 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 71 al.</bibl>; Gell. praef. § 3; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Carac. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inconexio: <entryFree id="n22493" type="main" key="inco_nexi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cōnexĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-conn-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, rhet. t. t., = <foreign lang="greek">a)su/ndeton,</foreign> <sense id="n22493.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the omission of a copulative particle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">asyndeton</hi>, Jul. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ruf.</author> de Schem. Lex. 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inconexus: <entryFree id="n22494" type="main" key="inco_nexus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cōnexus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inconn-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22494.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not joined together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disconnected</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Edyll. ad Paul. 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22494.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, gram. t. t., = <foreign lang="greek">a)suna/rthtos,</foreign> of metrical construction, <hi rend="ital">loose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disjointed</hi>, said of verses in which various forms of rhythm succeed one another, Mar. Vict. de Metr. p. 2534 P.; p. 2550 P.</sense></entryFree>
inconfectus: <entryFree id="n22495" type="main" key="inconfectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-confectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22495.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not wrought out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undigested</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 119</bibl>, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 16</bibl> (dub.).</sense></entryFree>
inconfusibilis: <entryFree id="n22496" type="main" key="inconfu_si^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inconfūsĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-confusus</etym>, <sense id="n22496.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be embarrassed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">confused</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">operarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Tim. 2, 15</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">inconfūsĭbĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">without confusion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">misceri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. An. 1, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inconfusus: <entryFree id="n22497" type="main" key="inconfu_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inconfūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22497.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unconfused</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n22497.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut inconfusus eat (mundus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:45" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recursus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons. Hon. 622</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22497.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">unembarrassed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not disconcerted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus intrepidus inconfususque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3 praef" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3 praef.</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; id. de Ira, 1, 12, 3.</sense></entryFree>
incongelabilis: <entryFree id="n22498" type="hapax" key="inconge^la_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incongĕlābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-congelo</etym>, <sense id="n22498.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be frozen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare omne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:8:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 8, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incongressibilis: <entryFree id="n22499" type="hapax" key="incongressi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incongressĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. incongredior</etym>, <sense id="n22499.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unapproachable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inaccessible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Deus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incongrue: <entryFree id="n22500" type="main" key="incongru^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incongrŭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. incongruus <sense id="n22500.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
incongruens: <entryFree id="n22501" type="main" key="incongru^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-congrŭens</orth>, <itype>tis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22501.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inconsistent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incongruous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unsuitable</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 9, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod est incongruens et absurdum, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 8, 35</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Stoica disciplina pleraque est et sibi et nobis incongruens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:5:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 5, 5</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">subject.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incongruens est in labris habere bonitatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 16, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 17, 6</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Don. Persev. 61" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Don. Persev. 61</bibl>.— * <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">incongrŭenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unsuitably</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> de Baptism. 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incongruentia: <entryFree id="n22502" type="main" key="incongru^enti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-congrŭentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n22502.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unsuitableness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incongruity</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">definitionis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incongruus: <entryFree id="n22503" type="main" key="incongru^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-congrŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22503.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inconsistent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incongruous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unsuitable</hi> = incongruens, inconveniens (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quam incongruo ambitu amplectar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:1:12" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se propositiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 19</bibl>; Symm. ep. 4, 8.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">incon-grŭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unsuitably</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 13</bibl>; Aug. ad Hier. ep. 17.</sense></entryFree>
inconivens: <entryFree id="n22504" type="main" key="inco_ni_vens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cōnīvens</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">inconnīvens</orth>), <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-conniveo</etym>, <sense id="n22504.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that does not close the eyes</hi> (late Lat.). </sense><sense id="n22504.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">stare solitus Socrates dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22504.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of the eye, <hi rend="ital">that does not close</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unclosing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitiae oculus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 2, 20</bibl></cit>. <pb n="927" /> <cb n="INCO" /></sense></entryFree>
inconjugus: <entryFree id="n22505" type="main" key="inconju^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-conjŭgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: verba (<sense id="n22505.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">epithets</hi>, etc.), <hi rend="ital">not applicable to ordinary names</hi> (e. g. fulminat and tonat can be said of Jupiter only), <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1065</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
inconnexus: <entryFree id="n22506" type="main" key="inconnexus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-connexus</orth>, v. inconexus.</entryFree>
inconnivus: <entryFree id="n22507" type="main" key="inconni_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inconnīvus</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">incōnīvus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-coniveo</etym>, <sense id="n22507.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that does not close the eyes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sleepless</hi> (Appuleian; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">inconivens): vigiliae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 179, 5</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22507.1" n="II" level="1"> Of the eyes, <hi rend="ital">not closing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 124, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inconscius: <entryFree id="n22508" type="main" key="inconsci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-conscĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22508.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unaware</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unconscious</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 10, 4</bibl> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 12, 4</bibl>, the correct reading is insciis).</sense></entryFree>
inconscriptus: <entryFree id="n22509" type="main" key="inconscriptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-conscriptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22509.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not arranged</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">incondita, id est inconscripta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. E. 2, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inconsentaneus: <entryFree id="n22510" type="main" key="inconsenta_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-consentānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22510.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unsuitable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfit</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 228 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
inconsequens: <entryFree id="n22511" type="main" key="inconse^quens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-consĕquens</orth>, <itype>tis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22511.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not logically consequent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconsequent</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">locutio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:ad Cic. Verr. 2:9" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> ad Cic. Verr. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per inconsequens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">inconsĕ-quenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">inconsequentially</hi>, <hi rend="ital">illogically</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:4:36" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 4, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:3:17:172" default="NO">3, 17, 172</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inconsequentia: <entryFree id="n22512" type="main" key="inconse^quenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inconsĕquentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inconsequens</etym>, <sense id="n22512.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">want of logical connection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconsequence</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">rerum foedissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:50" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 50</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inconsiderans: <entryFree id="n22513" type="main" key="inconsi_de^rans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-consīdĕrans</orth>, <itype>tis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22513.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inconsiderate</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">inconsiderantissime Marcion,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-consīdĕranter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">inconsiderately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutor, qui inconsideranter pupillum abstinuit hereditate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:10:3:section=17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 10, 3, § 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> p. 108</bibl>, n. 20.</sense></entryFree>
inconsiderantia: <entryFree id="n22514" type="main" key="inconsi_de^ranti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inconsīdĕrantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inconsiderans</etym>, <sense id="n22514.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">want of reflection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconsiderateness</hi> (= temeritas, incuria): <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus inconsiderantiam sustinere (where some read considerantiam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirari inconsiderantiam (al. inconsiderationem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 39</bibl></cit>; Salv. Gub. Dei, 1, 11.</sense></entryFree>
inconsiderate: <entryFree id="n22515" type="main" key="inconsi_de^ra_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inconsīdĕrātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. inconsideratus <sense id="n22515.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inconsideratio: <entryFree id="n22516" type="main" key="inconsi_de^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inconsīdĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n22516.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inconsiderateness</hi> (late Lat.): mentis, Salv. de Gub. Dei, 1 <hi rend="ital">extr.;</hi> cf. inconsiderantia. — From <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-consīdĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (class.). </sense><sense id="n22516.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thoughtless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heedless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconsiderate</hi> (cf. inconsultus): <cit><quote lang="la">nos ita leves atque inconsiderati sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:27:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 27, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam natura muliebris facit inconsideratam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 16, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inconsideratior in secunda, quam in adversa fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 5</bibl></cit>; so in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22516.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unconsidered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unadvised</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconsiderate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inconsideratissima temeritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:chapter=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 26</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-consīdĕrātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">inconsiderately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rashly</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">temere et fortuito, inconsiderate, negligenterque agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:29:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 29, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tractare aliquid,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 38, 60</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inconsideratius proeliando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:5:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 5, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inconsilium: <entryFree id="n22517" type="main" key="inconsi^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-consĭlĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n22517.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ill-advisedness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thoughtlessness</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)bouli/a,</foreign> Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
inconsitus: <entryFree id="n22518" type="hapax" key="inconsi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inconsĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-consero</etym>, <sense id="n22518.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unsown</hi>, <hi rend="ital">untilled</hi> ( = incultus): <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=36" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 36</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
inconsolabilis: <entryFree id="n22519" type="main" key="inconso_la_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inconsōlābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-consolor</etym>, <sense id="n22519.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inconsolable</hi>, trop. <hi rend="ital">incurable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:426" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 426</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: maeror, Ambros. de Elia. et Jejun. 16, § 60.</sense></entryFree>
inconsonans: <entryFree id="n22520" type="main" key="inconso^nans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-consŏnans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22520.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ill-sounding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unsuitable;</hi> with incongruum, Pompei. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Donat.</author> de Barb. 6</bibl>. — <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-consŏnanter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unsuitably;</hi> with inconsequenter, Vet. Interpr. Iren. 5, 17.</sense></entryFree>
inconspectus: <entryFree id="n22521" type="main" key="inconspectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-conspectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22521.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">indiscreet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imprudent</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">inconspectum aliquid temere dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:21:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 21, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inconspicuus: <entryFree id="n22522" type="main" key="inconspi^cu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-conspĭcŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22522.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not conspicuous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not remarkable</hi> ( = inglorius, ignobilis; <cit><quote lang="la">post-Aug.): mors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:67" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22522.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Invisible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 838</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, § 593</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inconspretus: <entryFree id="n22523" type="gloss" key="inconspre_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inconsprētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inconsperno</etym>, <sense id="n22523.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not despised</hi> or <hi rend="ital">slighted</hi>: non improbatus, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=107" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 107</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
inconstabilitio: <entryFree id="n22524" type="main" key="inconsta_bi^li_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inconstābĭlītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n22524.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not standing firmly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 4</bibl> Esdr. 15, 16.</sense></entryFree>
inconstans: <entryFree id="n22525" type="main" key="inconstans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-constans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22525.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inconstant</hi>, <cb n="INCO" /> <hi rend="ital">changeable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fickle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">capricious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconsistent</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n22525.1" n="I" level="1"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi ridicule es visus esse inconstans, qui eundem et laederes, et laudares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus in omnibus inconstantissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 99" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 99</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22525.2" n="II" level="1"> Of inanim. and abstr. things: <cit><quote lang="la">inconstans est, quod ab eodem de eadem re diverse dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:50:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 50, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 80, § 352</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medendi arte nulla inconstantior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid inconstantius Deo?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 62</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inconstantissimo vultu et maestissimo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:30:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 30, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">inconstanter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">inconstantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">capriciously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconsistently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jactantibus se opinionibus inconstanter et turbide,</quote> <trans><tr>inconsistently and confusedly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:10:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 17, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec dicuntur inconstantissime,</quote> <trans><tr>without the least consistency</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:27:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 27, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adductus primo ita negare inconstanter, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:55:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 55, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Afr. 82" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Afr. 82</bibl></cit>: agens, M. Aurel. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:ad Caes. 3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> ad Caes. 3</bibl>, ep. 2.</sense></entryFree>
inconstantia: <entryFree id="n22526" type="main" key="inconstanti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inconstantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inconstans</etym>, <sense id="n22526.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inconstancy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">changeableness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fickleness</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n22526.1" n="I" level="1"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est inconstantia, mobilitate, levitate, cum singulis hominibus, tum vero universo senatui turpius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levitate implicata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama inconstantiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inconstantiae notam habere, Plin. ap. Trogas, 11, 52, 114, § 276: nemo doctus umquam mutationem consilii inconstantiam dixit esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22526.2" n="II" level="1"> Of inanim. and abstr. things: <cit><quote lang="la">fulgoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 13, 76, § 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 49, 50, § 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensurae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 26, 30, § 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frontis ac luminum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:101" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutabilitasque mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:35:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 35, 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inconstruo: <entryFree id="n22527" type="main" key="inconstru^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inconstrŭo</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-construo</etym>, <sense id="n22527.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to build up with</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Serm. 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inconsuetus: <entryFree id="n22528" type="main" key="inconsu^e_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-consŭētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n22528.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Unusual</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">sermo, Vitr. praef. 5: salsitudo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22528.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Unused</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unaccustomed;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opimae mensae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:282" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 282</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inconsulte: <entryFree id="n22529" type="main" key="inconsulte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inconsultē</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">inconsultō</orth>, <sense id="n22529.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>, v. 1. inconsultus <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inconsultus: <entryFree id="n22530" type="main" key="inconsultus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-consultus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n22530.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Not consulted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unasked</hi> (so perh. not in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">inconsulto senatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:36:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 36, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">inconsulto se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me inconsulto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 5, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">27, 2</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 6, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:107:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 107, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 4:8" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:18 al" default="NO">5, 18 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n22530.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">not regarded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not respected</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inconsulta potestate superiore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inconsulta pietate, Cod. Th. 15, 1, 37: inconsulta clementia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 15, 15, 1</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22530.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22530.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Without advice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not advised</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">inconsulti abeunt, sedemque odere Sibyllae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 452</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22530.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Unadvised</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconsiderate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indiscreet</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n22530.5" n="1" level="3"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">homo inconsultus et temerarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 6, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 15</bibl> (with praeceps; opp. circumspectus); <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 15</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">heu rebus servare serenis inconsulta modum (Capua),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:547" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 547</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22530.6" n="2" level="3"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">bene consultum inconsultum est, si id inimicis usui'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">largitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:44:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 44, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures turbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 40" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:1:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: aliquem inconsulto calore interficere, <hi rend="ital">in a sudden heat</hi>, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 4, 3, 6.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> in two forms. </sense><sense id="n22530.7" n="(a)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">incon-sultē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unadvisedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconsiderately</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">inconsulte ac temere dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:16:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 16, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inconsulte et incaute commissum proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:37:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 37, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temereque vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">processerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 45</bibl></cit>. <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inconsultius quam venerat se gessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 10, 5</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22530.8" n="(b)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">inconsultō</orth>: se in periculum mittere, Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 3, 5, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deleta et inducta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:4:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22531" type="hapax" key="inconsultus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inconsultus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>2. in-consulo</etym>, <sense id="n22531.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the not advising with another</hi> (anteclass.; only in the <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">inconsultu meo,</quote> <trans><tr>without consulting me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 130</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inconsummatio: <entryFree id="n22532" type="hapax" key="inconsumma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inconsummātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. in-consummo</etym>, <sense id="n22532.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">incompleteness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imperfection</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">generationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inconsummatus: <entryFree id="n22533" type="main" key="inconsumma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-consummātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22533.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unfinished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incomplete</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imperfect</hi> (post-class.); <cit><quote lang="la">with rudis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 14</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with subagrestis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 21, 10, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22533.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of persons, <hi rend="ital">uncultivated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not well educated</hi>, Ambros. de Fide, 2, 15, § 129.</sense></entryFree>
inconsumptibilis: <entryFree id="n22534" type="main" key="inconsumpti^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inconsumptĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-consumo</etym>,<cb n="INCO" />  <sense id="n22534.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not to be consumed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indestructible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perennitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 127, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inconsumptus: <entryFree id="n22535" type="main" key="inconsumptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-consumptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22535.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unconsumed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undiminished</hi> (Ovidian): <cit><quote lang="la">pars turis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:592" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 592</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jecur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:2:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inconsutilis: <entryFree id="n22536" type="hapax" key="inconsu_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inconsūtĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-consuo</etym>, <sense id="n22536.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not sewed together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without seam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Joh. 19, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inconsutus: <entryFree id="n22537" type="main" key="inconsu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-consūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22537.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not sewed together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without seam</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">tunica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 22, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incontaminabilis: <entryFree id="n22538" type="main" key="inconta_mi^na_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incontāmĭnābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-contamino</etym>, <sense id="n22538.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be defiled</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Deus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 7:3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 7, 3</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">incontāmĭnābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">without defilement</hi>, Aug. de Gen. ad Litt. c. ult.</sense></entryFree>
incontaminatus: <entryFree id="n22539" type="main" key="inconta_mi^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-contāmĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22539.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">uncontaminated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undefiled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pure</hi> (class., but not in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid incontaminati sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 16</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: a quibus longe absunt, ut incontaminatissimi perseverent, Aug. Civ. Dei, 9, 16, 1.</sense></entryFree>
incontanter: <entryFree id="n22540" type="main" key="incontanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incontanter</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">incontātus</orth>, v. incunct-.</entryFree>
incontemplabilis: <entryFree id="n22541" type="main" key="incontempla_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incontemplābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-contemplor</etym>, <sense id="n22541.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be looked upon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">contemplated</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">claritas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incontemptibilis: <entryFree id="n22542" type="main" key="incontempti^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incontemptĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-contemno</etym>, <sense id="n22542.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not contemptible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not to be despised</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Deus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incontentus: <entryFree id="n22543" type="hapax" key="incontentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-contentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22543.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unstretched</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides,</quote> <trans><tr>out of tune</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:27:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 27, 75</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incontiguus: <entryFree id="n22544" type="main" key="inconti^gu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incontĭgŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-contingo</etym>, <sense id="n22544.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be touched</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Deus omni est incontiguus tactu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, p. 267</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incontinens: <entryFree id="n22545" type="main" key="inconti^nens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-contĭnens</orth>, <itype>tis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n22545.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Not containing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not retaining</hi> (class., but not in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">uterus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 43, 68, § 168</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22545.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Incontinent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immoderate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intemperate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tityos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 17, 26</bibl></cit>. — With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:30:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 30, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">incon-tĭnenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">immoderately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intemperately</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n22545.2" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibum assumit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22545.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">incontinently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil incontinenter esse faciendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:8:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 8, 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
incontinentia: <entryFree id="n22546" type="main" key="inconti^nenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incontĭnentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>incontinens</etym>. <sense id="n22546.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">inability of containing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">retaining</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">urinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 15, 57, § 161</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22546.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">inability of restraining one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s desires</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greediness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incontinence</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">multa de incontinentia intemperantiaque disseruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 11, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incontradicibilis: <entryFree id="n22547" type="main" key="incontra_di_ci^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incontrādīcĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-contradico</etym>, <sense id="n22547.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be contradicted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undeniable</hi> (late Lat.); <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incontritus: <entryFree id="n22548" type="main" key="incontri_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-contrītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22548.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not contrite</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Orig. in Jer. Hom. 3, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incontroversus: <entryFree id="n22549" type="spur" key="incontro_versus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incontrōversus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, false read. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:57:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 57, 241</bibl>, for in controversiis or sine controversiis; v. Orell. and Klotz ad h. l.</entryFree>
inconveniens: <entryFree id="n22550" type="main" key="inconve^ni^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-convĕnĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n22550.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">not accordant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unsuitable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissimilar</hi> (class., but not used by Cic. or Cæs.): facta, Cass. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 13, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inconvenientia jungere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 13, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22550.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">unbefitting</hi> (post-class.); with <case>dat.</case>, App. de Mundo, p. 70, 7; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl>, Serm. 13, § 11.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">inconvĕnĭenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unsuitably</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Gen. ad Litt. 11:15" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Gen. ad Litt. 11, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Trin. 2:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Trin. 2, 9</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, Boëth. ap. Aristot. Libr. de Interp. p. 264.</sense></entryFree>
inconvenientia: <entryFree id="n22551" type="hapax" key="inconve^ni^enti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inconvĕnĭentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inconveniens</etym>, <sense id="n22551.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inconsistency</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incongruity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntatis et facti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> de Diff. 23, § 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inconversibilis: <entryFree id="n22552" type="main" key="inconversi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-conversĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22552.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not convertible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not to be turned about</hi> (in order or rank); <cit><quote lang="la">opp. conversibilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Music. 5:21" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Music. 5, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inconvertibilis: <entryFree id="n22553" type="main" key="inconverti^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inconvertĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-converto</etym>, <sense id="n22553.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unchangeable</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Hermog. 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Anim. 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inconvertibilitas: <entryFree id="n22554" type="main" key="inconverti^bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inconvertĭbĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>,<gen>f.</gen> <etym>inconvertibilis</etym>, <sense id="n22554.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unchangeableness</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Verbi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 1, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inconvincibilis: <entryFree id="n22555" type="main" key="inconvinci^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-convincĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22555.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not to be convinced</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Orig. in Jer Hom. 3, 1</bibl>. <pb n="928" /> <cb n="INCO" /></sense></entryFree>
inconvolutus: <entryFree id="n22556" type="hapax" key="inconvo^lu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inconvŏlūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-convolvo</etym>, <sense id="n22556.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conglobate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heaped together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">post inconvolutos multiplices casus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 2, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inconvulsus: <entryFree id="n22557" type="main" key="inconvulsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inconvulsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-convello</etym>, <sense id="n22557.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">undestroyed</hi> (late Lat.): inconvulsa a se vectigalium pensione, i. e. <hi rend="ital">while they are not relieved from the obligation of paying taxes</hi>, Fragm. Cod. Th. 5, 13, 14; <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 12, 14, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incopiosus: <entryFree id="n22558" type="main" key="inco_pi^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cōpĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22558.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not furnished with provisions</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">solitudo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> de Jejun. 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incoprio: <entryFree id="n22559" type="hapax" key="inco_^pri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incō^prĭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym><foreign lang="greek">kopri/as,</foreign> scurra</etym>, <sense id="n22559.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to defile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revile</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">civis omnes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Commod.</author> Instruct. 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incoquo: <entryFree id="n22560" type="main" key="inco^quo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cŏquo</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n22560.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to boil in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">with</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">to boil down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to boil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seethe</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.). </sense><sense id="n22560.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, constr. <hi rend="ital">aliquid rei alicui</hi> or <hi rend="ital">re aliquā</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">radices Baccho,</quote> <trans><tr>in wine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 279</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cotonea melle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:17:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 17, 18</bibl></cit>. § <cit><quote lang="la">60: glaesum adipe suis lactentis incoctum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 3, 11, § 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">allium fabae fractae incoctum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 6, 23, § 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num viperinus his cruor incoctus herbis me fefellit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:3:7" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucum incoqui sole,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 17, 37, § 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucum cum melle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se mixta et incocta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> — </sense><sense id="n22560.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to dip in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dye</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incocti corpora Mauri,</quote> <trans><tr>colored by the sun</tr>, <tr>sunburnt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:637" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 637</bibl></cit>: vellera Tyrios incocta rubores (<case>acc.</case> Graec.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:307" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 307</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stannum aereis operibus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to tin over</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:39:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 39, 17, 48, § 162</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22560.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">incoctum generoso pectus honesto (for imbutum),</quote> <trans><tr>imbued</tr>, <tr>filled with nobleness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:74" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos autem plena justitia et maturitas virtutis incoxerit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 21, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incoram: <entryFree id="n22561" type="main" key="inco_ram"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incōram</orth>, <itype>or, separately</itype>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">in cōram</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, for coram (Appuleian). <sense id="n22561.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">In the presence of;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> omnium, <hi rend="ital">in the presence of all</hi>, <hi rend="ital">before all</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 197, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9</bibl>, p. 221, 17: <cit><quote lang="la">sui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10</bibl></cit>, p. 241, 5: <cit><quote lang="la">populi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10</bibl></cit>, p. 249, 33 Hild. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>— </sense><sense id="n22561.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <hi rend="ital">openly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">publicly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 10:7" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 10, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:3" default="NO">3, 3</bibl>; cf. Hand, Turs. III. p. 358.</sense></entryFree>
incoronatus: <entryFree id="n22562" type="main" key="inco^ro_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cŏrōnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22562.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">uncrowned</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">simulacra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 155, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incorporabilis: <entryFree id="n22563" type="main" key="incorpo^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incorpŏrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-corpus</etym>, <sense id="n22563.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">incorporeal</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">habitu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 17 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
incorporalis: <entryFree id="n22564" type="main" key="incorpo^ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incorpŏrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22564.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bodiless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incorporeal</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quod est aut corporale est aut incorporale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 58:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 58, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:116" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 116</bibl></cit>: nomina, <hi rend="ital">that denote something incorporeal</hi>, e. g. virtus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 2, p. 579</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">incorpŏrāle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an incorporeal thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that which is unsubstantial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immaterial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicimus enim quaedam corporalia esse, quaedam incorporalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 58:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 58, 11</bibl></cit> sqq.; <cit><quote lang="la">89, 16: a corporibus se ad incorporalia transtulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 90:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 90, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22564.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., law t. t., <hi rend="ital">incorporeal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that which is not perceptible by any sense</hi>: res, <hi rend="ital">rights to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in things</hi> (opp. corporales, the things themselves), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:14" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 14</bibl> sqq.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">incorpŏrāle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an intangible possession</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a right</hi>: incorporalia sunt quae tangi non possunt, Gai. Inst. l. l. Abdy ad loc.; 3, 83 al.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Ben. 6:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 6, 2, 2</bibl>. — <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">incorpŏrālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">incorporeally</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> de Stat. An. 3, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incorporalitas: <entryFree id="n22565" type="main" key="incorpo^ra_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incorpŏrālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>incorporalis</etym>, <sense id="n22565.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">incorporeity</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 15, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 11, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> de Anim. 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incorporaliter: <entryFree id="n22566" type="main" key="incorpo^ra_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incorpŏrālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. incorporalis <sense id="n22566.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
incorporatio: <entryFree id="n22567" type="main" key="incorpo^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incorpŏrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>incorporo</etym>, <sense id="n22567.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an embodying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incorporating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnishing with a body</hi> (late Lat.). </sense><sense id="n22567.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. An. 2, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of Christ,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Inst. Div. Litt. 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22567.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">incorporation</hi> with the public funds, <hi rend="ital">paying into the treasury</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 10, 10, 3</bibl>; Cod. Th. 10, 9, 1 sqq.</sense></entryFree>
incorporatus: <entryFree id="n22568" type="main" key="incorpo^ra_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incorpŏrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from incorporo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22569" type="main" key="incorpo^ra_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-corpŏrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22569.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not embodied</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut incorporatum pro non corporato,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. An. 2, 2 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
incorporeus: <entryFree id="n22570" type="main" key="incorpo^re^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incorpŏrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-corpus</etym>, <sense id="n22570.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">incorporeal</hi> (post-class.): corpusne sit vox an incorporeum: hoc enim vocabulum quidam finxerunt proinde quod Graece dicitur <foreign lang="greek">a)sw/maton,</foreign> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:15:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 15</bibl>. <cb n="INCR" /></sense></entryFree>
incorporo: <entryFree id="n22571" type="main" key="incorpo^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-corpŏro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (postclass.). <sense id="n22571.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To fasten</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mark in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon a body.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22571.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">variae animalium effigies incorporantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 22, 20</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22571.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to incorporate</hi>: sibi, <hi rend="ital">with itself</hi> (of the church), Aug. Doctr. Christi, 2, 6, 7 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n22571.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To provide with a body</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to embody</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incorporate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incorporatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 12, 80</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22571.4" n="III" level="1"> Esp., transf., <hi rend="ital">to incorporate with the public funds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pay into the treasury</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum bonorum, quae ad fiscum pertinere dicuntur, si controversia moveatur, ante sententiam nec obsignari nec incorporari possunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. de Jure Fisc. 14</bibl></cit> Huschke.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">incorpŏrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">embodied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incorporate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">divellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 34:5" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 34, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incorrectus: <entryFree id="n22572" type="hapax" key="incorrectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-correctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22572.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">uncorrected</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unimproved</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:14:23" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 14, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incorrigibilis: <entryFree id="n22573" type="main" key="incorri^gi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-corrĭgĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22573.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not to be corrected</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cured</hi> (post-Aug.; syn. insanabilis), Sen. de Ira, 3, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
incorrupte: <entryFree id="n22574" type="main" key="incorrupte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incorruptē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. incorruptus <sense id="n22574.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
incorruptela: <entryFree id="n22575" type="main" key="incorrupte_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-corruptēla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inconrupt-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n22575.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imperishableness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incorruptibility</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Tert. de Carne Christi, 15; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 146:15" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 146, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:15:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 15, 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incorruptibilis: <entryFree id="n22576" type="main" key="incorrupti^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-corruptĭbĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inconrupt-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22576.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imperishable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incorruptible</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> de Anim. 50</bibl>. — * <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">incorruptĭbĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">imperishably</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 3:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 3, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incorruptibilitas: <entryFree id="n22577" type="main" key="incorrupti^bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incorruptĭbĭlĭtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inconrupt-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>incorruptibilis</etym>, <sense id="n22577.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imperishableness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incorruptibility</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 48 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incorruptibiliter: <entryFree id="n22578" type="main" key="incorrupti^bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incorruptĭbĭlĭter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inconrupt-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. incorruptibilis <sense id="n22578.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
incorruptio: <entryFree id="n22579" type="main" key="incorrupti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-corruptĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inconrupt-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n22579.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imperishableness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incorruptibility</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Trin. 13:7" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Trin. 13, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
