incorruptivus: <entryFree id="n22580" type="main" key="incorrupti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incorruptīvus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inconrupt-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-corrumpo</etym>, <sense id="n22580.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imperishable</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 152</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incorruptorius: <entryFree id="n22581" type="hapax" key="incorrupto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incorruptōrĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inconrupt-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22581.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imperishable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensus in Deo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incorruptus: <entryFree id="n22582" type="main" key="incorruptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-corruptus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inconrupt-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22582.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unspoiled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uninjured</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncorrupted</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n22582.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucus et sanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:9:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 9, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incorruptum a fraude advehentium frumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 19:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templa,</quote> <trans><tr>undestroyed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:33:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 33, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lignum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 5, 8, § 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 16, 30, § 101</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22582.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">uncorrupted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uninjured</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unadulterated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unbribed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not spoiled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not seduced</hi>, <hi rend="ital">genuine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pure.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22582.3" n="A" level="2"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">atque integri testes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">custos incorruptissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus blandientes,</quote> <trans><tr>that would not be seduced by flatterers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n22582.4" n="B" level="2"> Of inanim. and abstr. things: <cit><quote lang="la">sensus (with integri),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">integritas Latini sermonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:35:132" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 35, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquilarum genus ... incorruptae originis,</quote> <trans><tr>genuine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 3, 3, § 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium,</quote> <trans><tr>true</tr>, <tr>upright</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus disciplinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2, p. 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeda,</quote> <trans><tr>undiminished</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quonam id modo incorruptum foret,</quote> <trans><tr>could be done most surely</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 12</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">incorruptē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">uncorruptly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">justly</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">atque integre judicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:9:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 9, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scite atque incorrupte loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:21:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 21, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Marc. 9, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incoxo: <entryFree id="n22583" type="hapax" key="incoxo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incoxo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>in-coxa</etym>, <sense id="n22583.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bend down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cower</hi> or <hi rend="ital">squat down</hi>, Pomp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 39, 9</bibl> (Com. Fragm. v. 97 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
incrassatus: <entryFree id="n22584" type="main" key="incrassa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incrassātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from incrasso.</entryFree>
incrasso: <entryFree id="n22585" type="main" key="incrasso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-crasso</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n22585.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make thick</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stout</hi> (post-class.; used mostly in the <hi rend="ital">part.</hi>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Psych. 6</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-crassātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">made stout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fattened</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Jejun. 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
increabilis: <entryFree id="n22586" type="main" key="incre^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incrĕābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-creabilis</etym>, <sense id="n22586.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not of a created nature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">self-existent</hi> (eccl. Lat.): non peperit creatura eum qui est increabilis. Mar. Marc. Serm. 1, 7.</sense></entryFree>
increatus: <entryFree id="n22587" type="main" key="incre^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-crĕātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22587.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">uncreated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not made</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Didym. de Spir. Sanc. 8 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. An. 2, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
increbresco: <entryFree id="n22588" type="main" key="increbresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-crebresco</orth>, <itype>brŭi</itype> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">incrēbe-sco</orth>, bui), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n22588.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to become frequent</hi> or <cb n="INCR" /> <hi rend="ital">strong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to increase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gain ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prevail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spread</hi> (= crebrior fieri, augeri, crescere; <cit><quote lang="la">class.): mores deteriores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 20, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">auster increbruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 13, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemorum murmur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:359" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 359</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi videt increbescere pugnas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:1" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:20:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 20, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonnullorum sermo increbruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:Or. 4:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. Or. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde rem ad triarios redisse, proverbio increbruit,</quote> <trans><tr>grew into a proverb</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 8, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplina, quae nunc increbruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:3:section=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 3, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">late Latio increbrescere nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucernae lumen hilaratum,</quote> <trans><tr>became stronger</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 168</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
increbro: <entryFree id="n22589" type="hapax" key="incre_bro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-crēbro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n22589.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to do any thing frequently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin increbravit,</quote> <trans><tr>but if he has frequently done it</tr>, <tr>has often visited his mistress</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 29</bibl></cit> dub. (Speng.: sin crebras ducit; sc. noctes).</sense></entryFree>
incredendus: <entryFree id="n22590" type="main" key="incre_dendus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incrēdendus</orth>, v. incredundus.</entryFree>
incredibilis: <entryFree id="n22591" type="main" key="incre_di^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incrēdĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-credo</etym>. <sense id="n22591.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22591.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That cannot be believed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incredible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extraordinary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unparalleled</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam et prope singularis et divina vis ingenii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:38:172" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 1, 38, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedus sceleris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem facere incredibilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:13:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 13, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incredibilia probabilibus intexere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incredibile est,</quote> <trans><tr>it is incredible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 23, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeter spem atque incredibile hoc mihi obtigit,</quote> <trans><tr>unforeseen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incredibile est, quanta me molestia affecerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 32</bibl>. —With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incredibile est, a filio patrem occisum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incredibilem in modum concursus fiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incredibile quantum coaluere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 36, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—With <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> in <hi rend="ital">u</hi> (not in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">incredibile memoratu est, quam facile coaluerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 6, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22591.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Not worthy of belief</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">that is not believed</hi> (ante-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 3, 3</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n22591.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unbelieving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incredulous</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">incredibiles cogentur credere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Trim. p. 93, 25</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">incrēdĭbĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">incredibly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extraordinarily</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quibus ego incredibiliter delector,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 15, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consentire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 15, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pertimuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incredibilitas: <entryFree id="n22592" type="main" key="incre_di^bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incrēdĭbĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>incredibilis</etym> (post-class.). <sense id="n22592.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Incredibility</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:5:29" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 5, 29 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>— </sense><sense id="n22592.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Incredulity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">humana,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Trim. p. 93, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incredibiliter: <entryFree id="n22593" type="main" key="incre_di^bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incrēdĭbĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. incredibilis <sense id="n22593.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
increditus: <entryFree id="n22594" type="main" key="incre_di^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-crēdĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22594.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">disbelieved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discredited</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vaticinia Cassandrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socrat. p. 52, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incredulitas: <entryFree id="n22595" type="main" key="incre_du^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incrēdŭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>incredulus</etym>, <sense id="n22595.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">disbelief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incredulity</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n22595.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 111, 18</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n22595.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">religious disbelief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incredulity</hi>, Cod. Th. 16, 8, 19; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 6, 95</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">venit ira Dei super filios incredulitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Col. 3, 6 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
incredulus: <entryFree id="n22596" type="main" key="incre_du^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-crēdŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (perh. not anteAug.). <sense id="n22596.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unbelieving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incredulous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without faith</hi>: odi. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 188</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patronus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 8, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Judaei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:14:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 14, 2 al.</bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n22596.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incredible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:4:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incredundus: <entryFree id="n22597" type="main" key="incre_dundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incrēdundus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">incrēdendus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-credo</etym>, <sense id="n22597.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not to be believed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incredible</hi> (Appuleian): <cit><quote lang="la">fabula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 120, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potentiae caerimoniarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flor. 2, p. 351</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illecebrae frugum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mag. p. 304, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incrematus: <entryFree id="n22598" type="spur" key="incre^ma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incrĕmātus</orth>, false read. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:24" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 24</bibl>, instead of in crucem actis.</entryFree>
incremento: <entryFree id="n22599" type="main" key="incre_mento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incrēmento</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n22599.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to increase</hi> (late Lat.), Aug. c. Litt. Pet. 3, 54; Val. Prob. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> 3, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incrementulum: <entryFree id="n22600" type="hapax" key="incre_mentu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incrēmentŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>incrementum</etym>, <sense id="n22600.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little growth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">increase</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum locupletis uteri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 164, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incrementum: <entryFree id="n22601" type="main" key="incre_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incrēmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>incresco</etym>, <sense id="n22601.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">growth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">increase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">augmentation</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n22601.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of plants and animals: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ego vitium satus, ortus, incrementa commemorem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponendae sunt plantae majoris incrementi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Feb. 24, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">25, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvi incrementi animalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:15:6 al" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 15, 6 al.</bibl></cit> — </sense><sense id="n22601.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22601.3" n="1" level="3"> Concr., i. q. suboles, <hi rend="ital">progeny</hi> or <hi rend="ital">foster-child</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">magnum Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 49</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of recruits: incremento novari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:23" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: supponere vipereos dentes, populi incrementa<pb n="929" /> <cb n="INCR" />  futuri, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 103</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22601.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">That which promotes growth</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">alitudo (est) incrementum corporis, alimentum incrementum infantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, p. 2198" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, p. 2198</bibl></cit> P.—</sense><sense id="n22601.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">increase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">augmentation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">increment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">addition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">summo bono afferre incrementum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:27:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 27, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus tua semper in incremento erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illis incrementis (dignitatis), fecit viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:51" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriae, quarum in dies incremento bellum exarsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:58:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 58, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">existimatus initium et causa incrementorum patri fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnorum praefectorum et ducum haec incrementa sunt et rudimenta,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the young sons of persons of distinction</tr>, <tr>who grew up to be prefects and generals</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:24" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 24</bibl></cit>: domus, <hi rend="ital">additions to one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s estate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:259" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 259</bibl>.— As a rhet. fig., <hi rend="ital">an advancing from weaker to stronger expressions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an ascending towards a climax</hi> (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">au)/chsis</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § 28.</sense></entryFree>
increpatio: <entryFree id="n22602" type="main" key="incre^pa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incrĕpātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>increpo</etym>, <sense id="n22602.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chiding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rebuking</hi>, i. q. objurgation (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
increpative: <entryFree id="n22603" type="hapax" key="incre^pa_ti_ve_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incrĕpātīvē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>from the obsol. increpativus</etym>, <sense id="n22603.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">chidingly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 6, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
increpator: <entryFree id="n22604" type="main" key="incre^pa_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incrĕpātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>increpo</etym>, Gloss. <foreign lang="greek">e)pitimhth/s,</foreign> <sense id="n22604.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abuser</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per dilectionem accedit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 140, 6</bibl></cit>; Acr. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 174</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
increpatorius: <entryFree id="n22605" type="main" key="incre^pa_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incrĕpātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22605.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">chiding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">objurgatory</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
increpito: <entryFree id="n22606" type="main" key="incre^pi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incrĕpĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n22606.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq.</hi> [id.]. </sense><sense id="n22606.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To call</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cry out to</hi> one (class.). </sense><sense id="n22606.2" n="A" level="2"> Encouragingly, <hi rend="ital">to call upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">challenge</hi> (only in Verg.): <cit><quote lang="la">tum Bitiae dedit increpitans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:738" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 738</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22606.3" n="B" level="2"> Reprovingly, <hi rend="ital">to chide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rebuke</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">increpitare atque incusare Belgas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 15, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irridere ex muro atque increpitare vocibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 30, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbis quoque increpitans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostis amare, quid increpitas, mortemque minaris?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:900" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 900</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestatem seram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ob invidiam tibi increpitarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:26:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 26, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem segnitiae,</quote> <trans><tr>to accuse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:6" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ignaviam alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to cast up to one</tr>, <tr>reproach one with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:3:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 3, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n22606.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to beat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strike</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">languentia pectora dextrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:132" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 132</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
increpitus: <entryFree id="n22607" type="main" key="incre^pi^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incrĕpĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from increpo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22608" type="main" key="incre^pi^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incrĕpĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>increpo</etym>, i. q. increpatio, <sense id="n22608.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chiding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rebuking</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 52, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et increpitu daemonia expellens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
increpo: <entryFree id="n22609" type="main" key="incre^po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-crĕpo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ĭtum</itype> (increpavi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 9, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 52</bibl>: <sense id="n22609.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">increpatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:4:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 4, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> 7, 195</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 17, 7</bibl> Cod.), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make a noise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rush</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rustle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">patter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rattle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whiz</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n22609.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22609.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul ut discus increpuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 5, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corvorum increpuit densis exercitus alis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:382" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 382</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22609.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make a noise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be noised abroad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">increpui hibernum et fluctus movi maritumos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. prol. 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid increpuerit, Catilinam timeri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul atque increpuit suspicio tumultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid increparet terroris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:43:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 43, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec indigna miserandaque auditu cum apud timentes ... increpuissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:37:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 37, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22609.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to utter aloud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give forth</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">saevas increpat aura minas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:17:6" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 17, 6</bibl></cit>: tuba terribilem sonitum. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:504" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 504</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22609.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To cause to give forth</hi> a sound: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Juppiter atras increpuit nubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">increpuit unda latus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:4:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 4, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vincor ut credam miser Sabella pectus increpare carmina,</quote> <trans><tr>disturb</tr>, <tr>confuse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:28" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22609.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To make a noise at</hi> a person, <hi rend="ital">thunder at</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">timeo totus, ita me increpuit Juppiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22609.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22609.8" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To exclaim loudly against</hi> a person, <hi rend="ital">to blame</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upbraid loudly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to chide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rebuke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reprove.</hi>— With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquid increpavit filium?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maledictis omnes bonos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 21, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravibus probris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:45:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 45, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam deos verbis ferocioribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:23:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 23, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cunctantes arma capere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:35:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 35, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">increpat ultro Cunctantes socios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:830" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 830</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictator ad contionem advocatam increpuit,</quote> <trans><tr>spoke angrily</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 32, 2</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultro animos tollit dictis, atque increpat ultro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 127</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22609.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To accuse</hi> a person<cb n="INCU" />  of any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">avaritiae singulos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Cal. 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevitiae populum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 15</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22609.10" n="C" level="2"> With an abstract object, <hi rend="ital">to reprove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">censure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inveigh against</hi> any reprehensible quality or act of a person: <cit><quote lang="la">illis versibus increpant eorum arrogantiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 23, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illius in me perfidiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:48:199 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 48, 199 al.</bibl></cit>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">incrĕ-pĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> </sense><sense id="n22609.11" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Chided</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reproved</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefecti navium graviter increpiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 26, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 17, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22609.12" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Accused</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignaviae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Res Gest. Alex. M. 1:17" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Res Gest. Alex. M. 1, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
increpundia: <entryFree id="n22610" type="main" key="incre^pundia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incrĕpundia</orth>, <itype>for usual crepundia</itype>, Fab. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Gord. Fulgent. Aet. M. 11</bibl>.</entryFree>
incresco: <entryFree id="n22611" type="main" key="incresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cresco</orth>, <itype>ēvi</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n22611.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to grow in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi> any thing (perh. not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n22611.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non taedia animalium capillis increscunt,</quote> <trans><tr>do not grow in the hair</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 11, 46, § 163</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22611.2" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to grow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">increase</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimis quoque flumina dicunt Increvisse suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxime cibo eget, qui increscit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne cum increverint (arbores),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:21" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22611.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22611.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To grow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">increase in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animis discordibus irae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:688" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 688</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22611.5" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to increase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">augment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbus increscit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 951" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 951</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audacia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:33:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 33, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fremitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">increscere et invalescere sententiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 12</bibl></cit>.— Rhet., <hi rend="ital">to advance from weaker to stronger expressions</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc genus increscit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
increto: <entryFree id="n22612" type="main" key="incre_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incrēto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-creta</etym>, <sense id="n22612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to chalk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whiten with chalk</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">increta facies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 5, 17, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incretus: <entryFree id="n22613" type="main" key="incre_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incrētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from incerno.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22614" type="main" key="incre_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-crētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-cretus, <hi rend="ital">part.</hi> of cerno</etym>, <sense id="n22614.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unsifted</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ac sordidi furfures,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 194, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incriminatio: <entryFree id="n22615" type="main" key="incri_mi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-crīmĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n22615.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">blamelessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irreprehensibleness</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incrispatio: <entryFree id="n22616" type="main" key="incrispa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incrispātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>incrispo</etym>, <sense id="n22616.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a crisping</hi> or <hi rend="ital">curling</hi> of the hair (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 112:22" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 112, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:ad Paul. 22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Paul. 22</bibl> ext. 1; id. Petri, 3, 3.</sense></entryFree>
incrispo: <entryFree id="n22617" type="hapax" key="incrispo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incrispo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-crispus</etym>, <sense id="n22617.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to crisp</hi> or <hi rend="ital">curl</hi> (al. incrustare), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incrucio: <entryFree id="n22618" type="hapax" key="incru^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-crŭcĭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n22618.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to torture greatly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 109</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incrudesco: <entryFree id="n22619" type="hapax" key="incru_desco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-crūdesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n22619.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become very raw</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 81</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incruentatus: <entryFree id="n22620" type="hapax" key="incru^enta_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-crŭentātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22620.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not made bloody</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not bloody</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inque cruentatus Caeneus (per tmesin for incruentatusque),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:497" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 497</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22621" type="hapax" key="incru^enta_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-crŭentātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22621.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made bloody</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bloody</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 1, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incruente: <entryFree id="n22622" type="main" key="incru^ente_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incrŭentē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. incruentus <sense id="n22622.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
incruentus: <entryFree id="n22623" type="main" key="incru^entus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-crŭentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22623.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bloodless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that sheds no blood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without bloodshed</hi> (freq. in the histt., but not in Cic. or Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">certatum haud incruento proelio foret, ni, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:56:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 56, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 61:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 61, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:17:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 17, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 8</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 21, 29, 4; <cit><quote lang="la">7, 8, 7: miles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:29:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 29, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Darium incruentus devicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:17:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 17, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus,</quote> <trans><tr>in which no blood has been shed</tr>, <tr>that has not lost any men</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 92:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 92, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">incruentam urbem intrare,</quote> <trans><tr>without shedding of blood</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 10, 14</bibl>.— Hence, * <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">incrŭ-entē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">without bloodshed</hi>: vivere, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 10, 1094.</sense></entryFree>
incrustatio: <entryFree id="n22624" type="main" key="incrusta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incrustātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>incrusto</etym>, <sense id="n22624.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an incrusting</hi> of walls, e. g. with plaster, lime, marble, etc. (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">parietis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:2:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 2, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 50, 16, 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incrusto: <entryFree id="n22625" type="main" key="incrusto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-crusto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n22625.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cover with a coat</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to incrust</hi> (mostly anteand post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ollam sapā et farre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:14:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota maceria levi lapide aut tectoria intrinsecus incrustetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 15:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sincerum vas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to daub over virtues with the names of vices</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parietem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:2:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 2, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incubatio: <entryFree id="n22626" type="main" key="incu^ba_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incŭbātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>incubo</etym>, <sense id="n22626.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lying upon eggs</hi> (in order to hatch them), <hi rend="ital">a brooding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incubation.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22626.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">incubationi datur initium post novam lunam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 54, 75, § 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noxia ovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 56, 77, § 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">derelicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 60, 80, § 166</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22626.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an unlawful possession</hi>: diuturna, Cod. Th. 10. 1, 15; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:Just. 7:38:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Just. 7, 38, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incubator: <entryFree id="n22627" type="main" key="incu^ba_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incŭbātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n22627.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who lies in</hi> any place (post-class.): fani, <hi rend="ital">one who</hi> <cb n="INCU" /> <hi rend="ital">sleeps in a temple</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 49</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22627.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An oppressive</hi> or <hi rend="ital">unlawful possessor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inclementissimus aulae Siculae Dionysius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperii tyrannus dicitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 7, 266</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incubito: <entryFree id="n22628" type="main" key="incu^bi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incŭbĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n22628.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq.</hi> [incubo], <hi rend="ital">to lie in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">cellae, in quibus incubitant,</quote> <trans><tr>in which they brood</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:14:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 14, 9</bibl></cit>. In <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 43, 68, § 169</bibl>, the best read. is in cubitu.—In mal. part.: <cit><quote lang="la">jam incubitatus es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 4, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incubitus: <entryFree id="n22629" type="main" key="incu^bi^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incŭbĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from incubo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22630" type="main" key="incu^bi^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incŭbĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (only in <sense id="n22630.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>incubo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a lying upon</hi> (Plinian). </sense><sense id="n22630.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">dextri lateris,</quote> <trans><tr>a lying on the right side</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 14, § 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22630.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a brooding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incubation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 54, 75, § 152</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incubo: <entryFree id="n22631" type="main" key="incu^bo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cŭbo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ĭtum, āre</itype> (rarely āvi, ātum, in the sense of to brood), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n22631.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lie in</hi> a place or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi> a thing (class.). </sense><sense id="n22631.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic leno aegrotus incubat in Aesculapii fano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 61</bibl></cit>: namque incubare satius te fuerat Jovi, <hi rend="ital">against</hi> (the statue of) <hi rend="ital">Jupiter</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">umero incubat hasta,</quote> <trans><tr>rests</tr>, <tr>lies upon her shoulder</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:593" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 593</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi caetris superpositis incubantes flumen tranavere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 27, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his (utribus) incubantes tranavere amnem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:21:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 21, 18</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: ferro, <hi rend="ital">to fall upon one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s sword</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 259" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 259</bibl>.— In <hi rend="ital">part. pres.</hi>: incubans, <hi rend="ital">lying near to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bordering upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugum mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 17, 20, § 53</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22631.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n22631.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To sit upon eggs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to brood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hatch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gallinas incubare fetibus alienigenis patiemur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ova gallinis incubanda subicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 59, 79, § 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ova incubita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 3, 11, § 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22631.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To abide</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dwell in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rure incubabo in praefectura mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 1, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucos et specus,</quote> <trans><tr>to inhabit</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 150, 15</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Pregn.: tabernulam littori proximam, vitatis maris fluctibus, incubabant,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>entered and lodged</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 190</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22631.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lie in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rest in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">on</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">purpura atque auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 909" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 909</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavidusque pinnis anxiae noctis vigil incubabat,</quote> <trans><tr>on his wings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 570" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 570</bibl></cit> sq.—</sense><sense id="n22631.6" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To cling to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fall upon</hi>, said of mourners over the dead, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">indigna fui marito accendisse rogum, incubuisse viro?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:727" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 727</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:27 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 27 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n22631.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to brood over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to watch jealously over</hi> a thing, either to keep or get possession of it: <cit><quote lang="la">qui illi pecuniae, quam condiderat, spe jam atque animo incubaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:26:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 26, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:507" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 507</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:610" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 610</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publicis thesauris,</quote> <trans><tr>to retain sole possession of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opimae praedae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:10:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 10, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22631.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To press upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weigh upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be a burden to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fasten on</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut inhaerentem atque incubantem Italiae extorqueret Annibalem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:57" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">protervus menti furor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 268" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 268</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi mors gravis incubat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 401" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Thyest. 401</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22631.9" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To settle on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attach one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self to</hi> any thing. — <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, of bees: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi incubavere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 16, 15, § 45</bibl></cit>.— Usually with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">leo victor armento incubat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 733" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 733</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponto nox incubat atra,</quote> <trans><tr>glooms over</tr>, <tr>darkens</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis ipsis urbis faucibus incubaret,</quote> <trans><tr>took up a position at</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:10:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">but cf.: pigra incubat Caligo terras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Or. Mar. 236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum quod incubat urbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:494" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 494</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22632" type="main" key="incu^bo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incŭbo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. incubo</etym>, <sense id="n22632.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who lies upon</hi> any thing. </sense><sense id="n22632.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A spirit that watches over buried treasures</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum modo incuboni pileum rapuisset, thesaurum invenit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> Fragm. Trag. 38, 8</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22632.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The nightmare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incubus</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ab incubone deludi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 100" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de incubone praesumptio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 44</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incubus: <entryFree id="n22633" type="main" key="incu^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cŭbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22633.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the nightmare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incubus</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 15, 23; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 8, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incudo: <entryFree id="n22634" type="main" key="incu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cūdo</orth>, <itype>di, sum, ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n22634.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to forge with the hammer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fabricate</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>, used only in <hi rend="ital">part. pass.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">incusa auro dona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:52" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 52</bibl></cit>: lapis, <hi rend="ital">an indented</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sharpened stone for a handmill</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 275</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:1:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 1, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inculcatio: <entryFree id="n22635" type="main" key="inculca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inculcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inculco</etym>, <sense id="n22635.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inculcating</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inculcator: <entryFree id="n22636" type="main" key="inculca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inculcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n22636.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who tramples upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diaboli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Gnost. 6</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n22636.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who insists on</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inculcates</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 12, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
inculco: <entryFree id="n22637" type="main" key="inculco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-culco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-calco</etym>, <sense id="n22637.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to tread in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tread down</hi> (class., esp. in the trop. signif.). </sense><sense id="n22637.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to tread down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ram</hi> <pb n="930" /> <cb n="INCU" /> <hi rend="ital">down</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:20:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semen obrutum pavicula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 34</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22637.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22637.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To stuff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">press</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">force in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeca verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:31:111" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 31, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leviora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:15:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 15, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:12:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 12, 2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n22637.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To force upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to impress on</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inculcate in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id quod tradatur, vel etiam inculcetur, posse percipere animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:28:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 28, 127</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos non modo oculis imagines, sed etiam animis inculcatis: tanta est impunitas garriendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:38:108" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 38, 108 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">firmissima quaeque memoriae judicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">judicibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:130" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibusdam offeram, quibusdam etiam inculcabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 24:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inculcatum est Metello, te aratores evertisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:67:section=156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 67, § 156</bibl></cit>: se, <hi rend="ital">to obtrude one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeci, qui se inculcant auribus nostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 5, 19</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <hi rend="ital">part. pass.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">inculcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">pressed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stuffed</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">crammed in</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n22637.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lana morsibus canis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 2, 9, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:15:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 15, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22637.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">mixed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">foisted in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inania verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:69:250" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 69, 250</bibl></cit>: <foreign lang="greek">a)rxe/tupon</foreign> crebris locis inculcatum et refectum, <hi rend="ital">emphasized by additions</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 3, 1</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">inculcātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">forcibly</hi> (late Lat.); <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: inculcatius, Aug. cont. <bibl default="NO"><author>Julian.</author> V. 16, 63</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inculpabilis: <entryFree id="n22638" type="main" key="inculpa_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-culpābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22638.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unblamable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blameless</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">numen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 1015</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>faultless</tr>, <tr>without a flaw</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 30</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">inculpābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">without blame</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 5, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 18</bibl> sq.</sense></entryFree>
inculpate: <entryFree id="n22639" type="main" key="inculpa_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inculpātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. inculpatus <sense id="n22639.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inculpatim: <entryFree id="n22640" type="hapax" key="inculpa_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inculpātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>inculpatus</etym>, <sense id="n22640.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without blame</hi>: ad calcem pervenire, Cod. Th. 6, 30, 20.</sense></entryFree>
inculpatus: <entryFree id="n22641" type="main" key="inculpa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-culpātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22641.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">blameless</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vita fidesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:673" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 673</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vita inculpatissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:6:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inculpatum visum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:22:4 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 22, 4 al.</bibl></cit>— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">inculpātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">without blame</hi>, Cod. Th. 9, 7, 1; Ambros. de Jac. et Vit. Beat. 2, 3, § 12; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Matt. 5, 10, 61</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inculte: <entryFree id="n22642" type="main" key="inculte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cultē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. incultus <sense id="n22642.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
incultus: <entryFree id="n22643" type="main" key="incultus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cultus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22643.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">untilled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncultivated</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n22643.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 12, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via, with silvestris,</quote> <trans><tr>neglected</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:72:259" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 72, 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid incultius oppidis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incultae atque inhabitabiles regiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:10:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incultum et derelictum solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:4:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caritas annonae ex incultis agris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:34:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 34, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22643.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">undressed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unadorned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unpolished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neglected</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rude</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">coma,</quote> <trans><tr>uncombed</tr>, <tr>disordered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:470" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 470</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genae,</quote> <trans><tr>disfigured</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:8:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 8, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo, ut vita, sic oratione durus, incultus, horridus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:31:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 31, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inculta atque rusticana parsimonia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indocti incultique,</quote> <trans><tr>without education</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines intonsi et inculti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:32:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 32, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <trans><tr>unpolished</tr>, <tr>rude</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <trans><tr>uncultivated</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Laestrygones,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>destitute of cultivation</tr>, <tr>savage</tr>, <tr>wild</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:59" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 59</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">incultē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in an uncultivated manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roughly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rudely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncouthly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inelegantly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inculte atque horride vivere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incultius agitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 89:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 89, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inculte horrideque dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:9:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non inculte dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22644" type="main" key="incultus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cultus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n22644.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">want of cultivation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">refinement</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">incultu, tenebris, odore foeda ejus (Tulliani) facies est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 55:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 55, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium incultu atque socordiā torpescere sinunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honores desertos per incultum ac negligentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 12, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incumba: <entryFree id="n22645" type="main" key="incumba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incumba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>incumbo</etym>, archit. t. t., <sense id="n22645.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the impost</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chaptrel</hi> of a pillar that bears the weight of an arch, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incumbo: <entryFree id="n22646" type="main" key="incumbo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incumbo</orth>, <itype>cŭbŭi, cŭbĭtum, ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>1. incubo</etym>, <sense id="n22646.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lay one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lean</hi> or <hi rend="ital">recline upon</hi> a thing (cf. ingruo; class., partic. in the trop. sense). </sense><sense id="n22646.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, constr. with <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">super</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">dat.;</hi> also with the simple <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">olivae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in parietem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:2:28" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">densis ordinibus nunc alii in alios, nunc in scuta incumbentes sustinebant impetus Romanorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:650" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 650</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:10:25" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super praedam,</quote> <trans><tr>to lie upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 9</bibl></cit>: ad vos, Ov. M. <cb n="INCU" /> 9, 385: <cit><quote lang="la">cumulatis in aqua sarcinis insuper incumbebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">validis incumbere remis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 294</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:9:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 9, 4</bibl>.—Of the heavens: <cit><quote lang="la">cava in se convexitas vergit, et cardini suo, hoc est terrae, undique incumbit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 64, 64, § 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <trans><tr>to cast itself into the sea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 32, 40, § 141</bibl></cit>: fessi arma sua, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg.
