A. 9, 229</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecto incubuit bubo,</quote> <trans><tr>perched on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 432</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladium faciam culcitam, camque incumbam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 4, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22646.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to lean</hi> or <hi rend="ital">incline towards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to overhang; to rush towards</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">silex prona jugo laevum incumbebat ad amnem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laurus incumbens arae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 514</bibl></cit>: in gladium, <hi rend="ital">to fall on one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s sword</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:51:154" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 51, 154</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 11, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:10:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hostem,</quote> <trans><tr>to press upon the enemy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:34:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 34, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">duo duces circumstare urbem ... et unum in locum totam periculi molem, omne onus incubuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:40:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 40, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22646.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22646.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To press upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oppress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weigh upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incubuere (venti) mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestas a vertice silvis incubuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:311" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 311</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravis incumbens scopulis aestas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 377</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">febrium terris incubuit cohors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(aestus) incubuit populo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 142</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevior armis Luxuria incubuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:292" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 6, 292</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22646.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To bend one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s attention to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to apply</hi> or <hi rend="ital">devote one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to exert one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">take pains with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pay attention to;</hi> constr. with <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogandis legibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:16" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceris et stilo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:27:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 27, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:820" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 820</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toto pectore novae cogitationi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et animo et opibus in bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut jam inclinato (judici) reliqua incumbat oratio,</quote> <trans><tr>press upon</tr>, <tr>exert influence on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:79:324" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 79, 324</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">invidia mihi incumbit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliquod studium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:8:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 8, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 4, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acrius graviusque ad ulciscendas rei publicae injurias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota mente in aliquam curam et cogitationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toto pectore ad laudem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omni cogitatione curaque in rem publicam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fato urguenti incumbere,</quote> <trans><tr>to press on</tr>, <tr>hasten</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:653" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 653</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sarcire ruinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 249</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delatorem pervertere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Appius Claudius ... cum suis tum totius nobilitatis viribus incubuit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 15, 8</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc, nunc incumbere tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:657" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 657</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22646.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To incline</hi>, <hi rend="ital">choose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be inclined to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lean towards</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc servi esse officium reor, ... non quo incumbat eum (i. e. erum) inpellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eos, qui audiunt, quocumque incubuerit, possit impellere,</quote> <trans><tr>whithersoever he may incline</tr>, <tr>choose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:14:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 14, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem incumbunt municipia,</quote> <trans><tr>are inclined the same way</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 6, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad voluntatem perferendae legis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 19, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntatum inclinatio ad virum bonum,</quote> <trans><tr>to lean towards</tr>, <tr>turn to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:26:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 26, 53</bibl></cit>: in causam, Cael. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 11, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in cupiditatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in illo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 8, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22646.7" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be incumbent upon</hi> one as a duty (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">accusandi necessitas domino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:2:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ei probatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:3:2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 22, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judici omnium rerum officium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:25" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 21, 1, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incumulatio: <entryFree id="n22647" type="main" key="incu^mu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incŭmŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>in-cumulo</etym>, <sense id="n22647.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a filling up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">puffing out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">buccarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incunabula: <entryFree id="n22648" type="main" key="incu_na_bu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cūnābŭla</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n22648.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">swaddlingclothes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swathing-bands.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22648.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fasciis opus est, pulvinis, cunis, incunabulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 5, 1, 52</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n22648.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22648.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The cradle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bacchi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 317</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22648.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A birthplace</hi>: in montes patrios, et ad incunabula nostra pergam, Poët. (perh. Enn.) ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 15, 3</bibl> (v. Vahl. <bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> p. 81</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:8:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 31, 8, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22648.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Childhood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam inde ab incunabulis imbutus odio tribunorum,</quote> <trans><tr>from the cradle</tr>, <tr>from childhood</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ab primis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 6, 4</bibl></cit>; and: in primis vitae incunabulis, Firm. 1, 3.— </sense><sense id="n22648.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an origin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beginning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de oratoris quasi incunabulis dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:13:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 13, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostrae doctrinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 6, 23</bibl></cit>: ab ipsis discendi velut incunabulis, Quint. prooem. 6 Zumpt <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
incunctabilis: <entryFree id="n22649" type="main" key="incuncta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incunctābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-cunctor</etym>, <sense id="n22649.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that admits of no delay</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud quoque incunctabile est, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:5:21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 22, 5, 21</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">incunctābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unhesitatingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without delay</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> Sent. ad Phil. 4</bibl>. <cb n="INCU" /></sense></entryFree>
incunctans: <entryFree id="n22650" type="main" key="incunctans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cunctans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22650.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not delaying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unhesitating</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">fides,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Petr.</author> Vit. S. Mart. 5, 233</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cunctan-ter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">incont-</orth>), <hi rend="ital">without delay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unhesitatingly</hi> (post-class.); <cit><quote lang="la">with fortiter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fateri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 15, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incunctanter et liberius respondere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 234, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:2:20 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 2, 20 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
incunctatus: <entryFree id="n22651" type="hapax" key="incuncta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incunctātus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">incontātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-cunctatus</etym>, <sense id="n22651.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">undelayed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum penetrant,</quote> <trans><tr>without delay</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 165, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incupidus: <entryFree id="n22652" type="hapax" key="incu^pi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cŭpĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22652.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very desirous</hi>: incupidiores liberūm, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 496, 5</bibl> (Com. Fragm. v. 361 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
incurabilis: <entryFree id="n22653" type="main" key="incu_ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incūrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-curo</etym>, <sense id="n22653.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">incurable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without remedy</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 2, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incuratus: <entryFree id="n22654" type="main" key="incu_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cūrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> * <sense id="n22654.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Uncared for</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidquam (with imperfectum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 28</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n22654.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Uncured</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulcera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incuria: <entryFree id="n22655" type="main" key="incu_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incūrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. in - cura</etym>, <sense id="n22655.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">want of care</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carelessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">negligence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neglect</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">milites populi R. incuriā, fame, morbo, vastitate consumpti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:chapter=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum comperta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel tolerantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei maxime necessariae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 23, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maculae quas aut incuria fudit Aut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 352</bibl></cit>: capilli, Tert. Poen. <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi></sense></entryFree>
incuriose: <entryFree id="n22656" type="main" key="incu_ri^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cūrĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. incuriosus <sense id="n22656.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
incuriositas: <entryFree id="n22657" type="main" key="incu_ri^o_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cūrĭōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n22657.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">carelessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">negligence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inattention</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 7, 4</bibl>; Salv. de Gub. Dei, 1.</sense></entryFree>
incuriosus: <entryFree id="n22658" type="main" key="incu_ri^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cūrĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22658.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">careless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">negligent</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n22658.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">careless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unconcerned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regardless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indifferent</hi> respecting any thing; constr. with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <case>abl.</case>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22658.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proximorum incuriosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetera extollimus, recentium incuriosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperii proferendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum antiquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:5:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22658.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">serendis frugibus incuriosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 38</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22658.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in capite comendo tam incuriosus, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:79" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 79</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22658.5" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter gaudentes et incuriosos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae praetermittere incuriosum videbatur, Sol. praef.: unde unguibus inuncet agnum incuriosum,</quote> <trans><tr>heedless</tr>, <tr>off his guard</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 1, p. 341, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22658.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">careless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">negligent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not made</hi> or <hi rend="ital">done with care</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">finis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">historia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">incūrĭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">carelessly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">negligently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra posita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:38:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 38, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacis modo, incuriose agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">(with abjecte): verbum positum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:6:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:14:4" default="NO">12, 14, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:13 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 13 al.</bibl>— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incuriosius cohortes agentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 26, 46, § 110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:81" default="NO" valid="yes">13, 12, 25, § 81</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incurro: <entryFree id="n22659" type="main" key="incurro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-curro</orth>, <itype>curri and cŭcurri</itype> (incurri, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:67:224" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 67, 224</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:37:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 37, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 21, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:5:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 5, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:13:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 13, 1</bibl> saep.: <sense id="n22659.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">incucurri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:18:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 18, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 96:1 al" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 96, 1 al.</bibl>), <itype>cursum, ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [in-curro], <hi rend="ital">to run into</hi> or <hi rend="ital">towards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">run upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fall in with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rush at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attack</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n22659.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22659.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incurristi amens in columnas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:67:224" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 67, 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:17:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 17, 68</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">fig.: mihi videtur praetorius candidatus in consularem quasi desultorius in quadrigarum curriculum incurrere,</quote> <trans><tr>to run into</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:27:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 27, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:9:7" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 9, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22659.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">armentis incurrere fortibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:546" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 546</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proeliantibus Romanis,</quote> <trans><tr>to rush upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levi armaturae hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 17, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peditum signa cornibus incurrerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mauris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 101:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 101, 8</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22659.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With a simple <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque eos a tergo incurrerunt, Sall. Fragm. ap. Rufin. de Schem. Lex.: tota vi novissimos,</quote> <trans><tr>to attack</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22659.5" n="2" level="3"> Milit., <hi rend="ital">to make an inroad</hi> or <hi rend="ital">irruption</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to invade</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Macedoniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 25, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in agrum suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in provincias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:4:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22659.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to border on</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri, qui in publicum Campanum incurrebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:30:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 30, 82</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22659.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22659.8" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">in oculos incurrentes,</quote> <trans><tr>meeting the sight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 21, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id quod oculis incurrit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non solum in oculos, sed etiam in voculas malevolorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: ordinem sequens in memoriam notam et aequalem necessario incurro, <hi rend="ital">I am led to</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:69:244" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 69, 244</bibl>: in maximam fraudem, <hi rend="ital">to fall into</hi>, id. <pb n="931" /> <cb n="INCU" /> Off. 3, 13, 55: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestus in odia hominum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 42, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in magnam aliquam difficultatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor in varias reprehensiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in morbos, in damna, in dedecora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in alterum genus injustitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:9:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 9, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in memoriam notam et aequalem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:69:244" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 69, 244</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in memoriam communium miseriarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 71, 251</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22659.9" n="2" level="3"> With <case>acc.</case> (post-class.), <hi rend="ital">to incur</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen loquacitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incursus angor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 9</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22659.10" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n22659.11" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To run against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strike against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si jactor in turba, accuso ... eum qui in me incurrit atque incidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in eum non invasisse, sed incurrisse videamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 6, 14</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis est tam lynceus, qui in tantis tenebris nihil offendat, nusquam incurrat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 2, 2</bibl></cit>. — With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venantium agmen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Dial. 2, 9, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22659.12" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To commit</hi> a fault (only postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">nihil vitii mulier incurrit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:1:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22659.13" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To rush upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assault carnally</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si nihil est, servis incurritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:331" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 331</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sororem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 250, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22659.14" n="4" level="3"> Of events, <hi rend="ital">to befall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">happen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occur to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">casus, qui in sapientem potest incurrere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:10:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ipsos etesias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: tua <foreign lang="greek">lh=yis</foreign> in quem diem incurrit, nescio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">natalis plebeiis incurrens Circensibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disputatio, in quam non aliquis locus incurrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:21:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 21, 79</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incursatio: <entryFree id="n22660" type="main" key="incursa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incursātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>incurso</etym>, <sense id="n22660.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an attack</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 44, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incursax: <entryFree id="n22661" type="hapax" key="incursax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incursax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that makes frequent inroads</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Massagetae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incursim: <entryFree id="n22662" type="hapax" key="incursim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incursim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>incurro</etym>, <sense id="n22662.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rapidly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quickly</hi>, Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 127, 20</bibl> (Com. Fragm. v. 46 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
incursio: <entryFree id="n22663" type="main" key="incursi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incursĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22663.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a running against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">onset</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assault</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attack</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n22663.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">atomorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:41:114" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 41, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque impetus armatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 15, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 14</bibl> Spald. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n22663.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a hostile inroad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incursion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostiliter in fines Romanos incursionem facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prohibere hostem ab incursionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subitas hostium incursiones sustinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:11" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moliri incursionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 28, 32, § 146</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incursito: <entryFree id="n22664" type="main" key="incursi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incursĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n22664.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [incurso], <hi rend="ital">to rush upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assault</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attack</hi> (a favorite word of Seneca). </sense><sense id="n22664.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 27" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incursitans, instans, fugans, id. de Ira, 2, 35: in multos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22664.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to dash against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clash with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">totā vitā incursitamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 110" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 110</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incurso: <entryFree id="n22665" type="main" key="incurso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incurso</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n22665.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n. and a.</hi> [incurro], <hi rend="ital">to run to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dash</hi> or <hi rend="ital">strike against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to assault</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attack</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n22665.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22665.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam in vos incursabimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in agmen Romanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 14, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22665.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With the simple <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem pugnis,</quote> <trans><tr>to pitch into</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(me) boves incursent cornibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 57</bibl></cit>: ubi vivos homines mortui incursant boves (meaning <hi rend="ital">raw hides</hi> as whips), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 1, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agros Romanos,</quote> <trans><tr>to make an incursion into</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:31:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 31, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:48:6" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 48, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:36:1" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 36, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">latera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:18:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 18, 14</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen incursatum ab equitibus hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 1</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvasque tenent delphines, et altis Incursant ramis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 303</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rupibus incursat,</quote> <trans><tr>runs against the rocks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:190" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 190</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22665.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to fall upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assault a woman carnally</hi> (post - class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nuptam alienam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pud. 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22665.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea, quae oculis vel auribus incursant,</quote> <trans><tr>that strike</tr>, <tr>meet them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pleraque in oculos incurrunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incurrit haec nostra laurus in oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lana ovis nigrae, cui nullus alius color incursaverit,</quote> <trans><tr>is intermixed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 28, § 111</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22665.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">incursabit in te dolor meus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:41:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 41, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omnes amicos atque inimicos, notos atque ignotos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 39, 51</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incursus: <entryFree id="n22666" type="main" key="incursus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incursus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from incurro.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22667" type="main" key="incursus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incursus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>incurro</etym>, <sense id="n22667.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a running against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an assault</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attack</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n22667.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceterorum tela atque incursus refugit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitum incursus sustinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:18:4" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 18, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo statim incursu,</quote> <trans><tr>at the first onset</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 25, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22667.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim. <cb n="INCU" /> things, <hi rend="ital">a rushing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dashing against</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">undarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:497" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 497</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:731" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 731</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pluviarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:700" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 700</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis,</quote> <trans><tr>of the sunbeams</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:22" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22667.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an impulse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effort</hi>: incursus animus varios habet, <hi rend="ital">has</hi> or <hi rend="ital">entertains different impulses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 152</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incurvabilis: <entryFree id="n22668" type="main" key="incurva_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incurvābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-curvabilis</etym>, <sense id="n22668.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not flexible</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">pedes elephantorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 10, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incurvatio: <entryFree id="n22669" type="main" key="incurva_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incurvātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>incurvo</etym>, <sense id="n22669.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bending</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curving</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">materiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 207</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caudae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 3:16" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 3, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incurvesco: <entryFree id="n22670" type="hapax" key="incurvesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incurvesco</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-visco</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>incurvus</etym>, <sense id="n22670.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bend down</hi>: bacarum ubertate, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:38:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 38, 154</bibl>; and ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:28:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 28, 69</bibl> (Trag. v. 194 Vahl.; Trag. Inc. Fab. v. 135 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
incurvicervicus: <entryFree id="n22671" type="hapax" key="incurvi^cervi_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-curvĭ-cervīcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>incurvus-cervix</etym>, <sense id="n22671.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having a crooked</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wry neck</hi>: pecus, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 7</bibl> Müll.; and ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:67" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 67</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 408 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
incurvisco: <entryFree id="n22672" type="main" key="incurvisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incurvisco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. incurvesco.</entryFree>
incurvo: <entryFree id="n22673" type="main" key="incurvo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-curvo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n22673.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crook</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curve</hi> (in Cic. only once in <hi rend="ital">part. pass.;</hi> elsewhere <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n22673.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">flexos arcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:500" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 500</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">robur et olea incurvantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 42, 81, § 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lentos remos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 183</bibl></cit>.—Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">incurvari,</quote> <trans><tr>to be bowed down</tr>, <tr>bent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ad Polyb. 7:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> ad Polyb. 7, 2</bibl></cit>; Capitol. Ant. Pii, 13, 1. —In <hi rend="ital">part. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bacillum inflexum et incurvatum,</quote> <trans><tr>crooked</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:11:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 11, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22673.2" n="B" level="2"> Pregn., in mal. part., = paedicare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:43:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 43, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22673.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cast down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturb</hi>: non est magnus animus, quem incurvat injuria, Sen. de Ira, 3, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem querelā,</quote> <trans><tr>to move to commiseration</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:91" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 91</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incurvus: <entryFree id="n22674" type="main" key="incurvus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-curvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22674.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bowed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crooked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curved</hi> (opp. recurvus, pandus; class.). </sense><sense id="n22674.1" n="A" level="2"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">incurvus, tremulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incurvi umeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 52, 114, § 274</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22674.2" n="B" level="2"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">lituus, id est incurvum, et leviter a summo inflexum bacillum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:17:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 17, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statua Stesichori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:35:section=87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 35, § 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aratrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:494" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 494</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 12, 41, § 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:534" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 534</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:376" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 376</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incus: <entryFree id="n22675" type="main" key="incu_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incūs</orth>, <itype>ūdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>incudo</etym>, <sense id="n22675.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an anvil.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22675.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sine follibus et incudibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:20:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 20, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si faber incudem fregerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:2:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impositos duris crepitare incudibus enses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:540" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 540</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">positis incudibus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>having established smithies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:629" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 629</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novā Incude diffingere ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 35, 39</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">eandem incudem tundere,</quote> <trans><tr>to labor always at the same thing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:39:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 39, 162</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">28, 4, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22675.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec mihi incus est: procudam ego hinc hodie multos dolos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenes, et in ipsa studiorum incude positi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>still occupied with their education</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 20</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">philosophicā incude formatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: incudi reddere versus, <hi rend="ital">to return to the anvil</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to revise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retouch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:441" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 441</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incusabilis: <entryFree id="n22676" type="main" key="incu_sa_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incūsābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>incuso</etym>, <sense id="n22676.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">blameworthy</hi> (late Lat.); <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 1, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incusatio: <entryFree id="n22677" type="hapax" key="incu_sa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incūsātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22677.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a blaming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accusing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accusation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiorum, et peccatorum incusatio, aut querela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:27:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 27, 106</bibl></cit>; Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incusativus: <entryFree id="n22678" type="main" key="incu_sa_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incūsātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22678.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">accusing;</hi> for accusativus; casus, and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incusativus,</quote> <trans><tr>the accusative</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 296</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
incusator: <entryFree id="n22679" type="hapax" key="incu_sa_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incūsātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22679.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an accuser</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 36, 18, § 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incuso: <entryFree id="n22680" type="main" key="incu_so"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incūso</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-causa</etym>, <sense id="n22680.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to accuse</hi> one of something, <hi rend="ital">to complain of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">find fault with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blame</hi> (cf.: arguo, accuso, vitupero; class., but not in Cic.).—Constr. <hi rend="ital">aliquem alicujus rei</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aliquem quod</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aliquid</hi>, etc.—With <hi rend="ital">acc. of person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui alterum incusat probri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te ipse jure optumo merito incuses licet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem luxūs et superbiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehementer eos incusavit, quod,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:471" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 471</bibl>.— With <hi rend="ital">acc. of the thing</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 23, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">factum alicujus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 479</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">angustias stipendii, duritiam operum,</quote> <trans><tr>to complain of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">casus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6</bibl></cit>, <cb n="INDA" /> 23.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incusaverat bella ex bellis seri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 6, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:12:11" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 12, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:35:11" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 35, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Poenus dolo dimissum Romanum incusaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, with <case>nom.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 11, 24</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">part. pass.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">incūsātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">complained of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">found fault with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sterilitas cacuminis jure incusata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:17:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Augusto incusatae liberorum mortes,</quote> <trans><tr>charged upon</tr>, <tr>attributed to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 45, 46, § 149</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incussio: <entryFree id="n22681" type="main" key="incussi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incussĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>incutio</etym>, <sense id="n22681.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a falling in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inroad</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Jornand.</author> Get. 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incussor: <entryFree id="n22682" type="hapax" key="incussor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cussor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22682.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who strikes</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Petr.</author> Vit. S. Mart. 5, 285</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incussus: <entryFree id="n22683" type="main" key="incussus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incussus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from incutio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22684" type="main" key="incussus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incussus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>incutio</etym>, <sense id="n22684.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a striking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dashing against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a shock</hi> (rare, and only in <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">armorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arietis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. Sap. 6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. Sap. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silicis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cathem. 5, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incustoditus: <entryFree id="n22685" type="main" key="incusto_di_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-custōdītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n22685.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22685.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">not watched</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unguarded</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ovile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:6:10" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incustodita et aperta limina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:35:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 35, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22685.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22685.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Disregarded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neglected</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dierum observatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 55</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22685.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Unconcealed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 12</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>— </sense><sense id="n22685.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heedless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imprudent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incustoditus nimis et incautus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:29:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 29, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incusus: <entryFree id="n22686" type="main" key="incu_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n22686.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Part. pass.</hi>, from incudo.</sense></entryFree>
incutio: <entryFree id="n22687" type="main" key="incu^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incŭtĭo</orth>, <itype>cussi, cussum, ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>inquatio</etym>, <sense id="n22687.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strike upon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">against</hi> (syn.: impingo, illido, infligo; class.; in Cic. only in the trop. signif.). </sense><sense id="n22687.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">scipionem in caput alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:41:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 41, 9</bibl></cit>: pedem terrae, <hi rend="ital">to strike</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dash against</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:12:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 12, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pollicem limini cubiculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 53, 54, § 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tignum capiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:246" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 246</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incutiebantur puppibus prorae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incussi articuli,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>injured by a blow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 9, 23, § 78</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">incussa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">bruised</hi> or <hi rend="ital">injured parts</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 2, 9, § 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:37" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 14, 16, § 37</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n22687.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to throw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hurl</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tormentis faces et hastas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela saxaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imber grandinem incutiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:4:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colaphum,</quote> <trans><tr>to give a box on the ear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:5" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 5</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22687.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22687.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To strike into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to inspire with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflict</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi> terror, disturbance, etc. </sense><sense id="n22687.5" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: multis magnum metum, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrorem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religionem animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:42:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 42, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui foedum nuntium,</quote> <trans><tr>bring bad news</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animis subitam formidinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 13, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingentem animo sollicitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:6:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desiderium urbis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne forte negoti Incutiat tibi quid sanctarum inscitia legum,</quote> <trans><tr>should occasion trouble</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 1, 80</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22687.6" n="(b)" level="5"> Without <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">timor incutitur aut ex ipsorum periculis aut ex communibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:51:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 51, 209</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22687.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To shake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause to tremble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebrior incussit mentem pavor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:551" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 551</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indagabilis: <entryFree id="n22688" type="main" key="inda_ga_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indāgābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. indago</etym>, <sense id="n22688.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">investigating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inquiring</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 3, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indagatio: <entryFree id="n22689" type="main" key="inda_ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indāgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22689.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a searching into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">investigation</hi> (class. but rare): <cit><quote lang="la">initiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:24:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 24, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque inventio veri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:5:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rarioris verbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:2:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indagator: <entryFree id="n22690" type="main" key="inda_ga_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indāgātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22690.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who traces out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a tracker</hi> of prey, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">apum,</quote> <trans><tr>one who hunts swarms of bees</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:8:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 8, 12</bibl></cit>: aquarum, <hi rend="ital">a hunter of springs</hi> (= aquilex), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 2, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22690.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an investigator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">searcher</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">celatūm (for celatorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: rerum naturalium, Ser. Samm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 12, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 6, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indagatrix: <entryFree id="n22691" type="main" key="inda_ga_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indāgātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>indagator</etym>, <sense id="n22691.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who searches into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">investigates</hi>, <hi rend="ital">explores</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avaritia latentium indagatrix lucrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 4 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 23, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indagatus: <entryFree id="n22692" type="main" key="inda_ga_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indāgātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from 1. indago.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22693" type="main" key="inda_ga_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indāgātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. indago</etym> (only in the <sense id="n22693.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">an exploring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encircling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surrounding</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 191, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indages: <entryFree id="n22694" type="main" key="inda_ges"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indāges</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22694.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a searching into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">investigation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exploration</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim. 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Symm. 2, 845</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indago: <entryFree id="n22695" type="main" key="inda_go1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indāgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, āre</itype> (<sense id="n22695.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> form indagatur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=94" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 94</bibl> Müll.), <pos>v. a.</pos>, <pb n="932" /> <cb n="INDE" /> <hi rend="ital">to trace out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">track</hi>, as dogs in hunting (syn.: vestigo, scrutor; class.). </sense><sense id="n22695.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">canis natus ad indagandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:13:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 13, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=94" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 94</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae tactu quaeque naribus auribusque et oculis indagantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 10, 9</bibl></cit>.—So of hunting in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">bestiarum cubilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 14:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 14, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22695.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to search into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">investigate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">explore; hunt for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strive to obtain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neu rem ipsam indaget, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">eo si pacto posset indagarier mulier,</quote> <trans><tr>be traced</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indagare et odorari quid cuique opus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:54:section=135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 54, § 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indicia communis exitii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:37:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 37, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inusitatas vias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:3:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de re publica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clementiam misericordiamque apud judices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:3:18" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intervalla siderum a terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 21, 19, § 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepulchrum (Archimedis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:23:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 23, 64</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22696" type="main" key="inda_go2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indāgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n22696.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an encircling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enclosing</hi> (mostly post - Aug.). </sense><sense id="n22696.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of surrounding wild beasts with nets, in hunting: <cit><quote lang="la">dum trepidant alae, saltusque indagine cingunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">densos indagine colles Claudere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:3:7" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rates captae quasi per indaginem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:32" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indaginis modo sylvas persultare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 37</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n22696.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an enclosing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surrounding</hi> of enemies: <cit><quote lang="la">efferam gentem, ritu ferarum, quasi indagine debellabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:48" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 48</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:6:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 11</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">velut indagine aliquem insidiis circumdare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:18" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum praemissus eques velut indagine dissipatos Samnites ageret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:37:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 37, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vastaque feras indagine claudit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(delatores) in illa poenarum indagine inclusos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:35:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 35, 2</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">legacy-hunting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamenta et orbos velut indagine capi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22696.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a searching into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examining after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">investigation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis persuasisse doctrinae indaginibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 7, 6, § 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupediarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:16:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 16, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ampliorem exposcere indaginem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 4, 31, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium occulta scrutari indagine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 5, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indalbo: <entryFree id="n22697" type="main" key="indalbo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indalbo</orth>, v. inalbo.</entryFree>
indaudio: <entryFree id="n22698" type="main" key="indaudi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indaudĭo</orth>, v. inaudio.</entryFree>
inde: <entryFree id="n22699" type="main" key="inde"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inde</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>i-im, locative from is, and de = die; hence</etym>, <sense id="n22699.0" n="I" level="1"> Of place, <hi rend="ital">from that place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde e promptuaria cella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis me quaeret, inde me vocatote aliqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo die mansi Calibus: inde has litteras dedi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in provinciam exirent, atque inde in Italiam contenderent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec inde venit, unde mallem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 39, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Palaepolis fuit haud procul inde ubi nunc Neapolis sita est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 22, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triginta inde stadia abesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:8:24" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 8, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si legiones sese recepissent inde quo temere essent progressae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 45</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> loci (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">inde loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:438 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 438 al.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=327" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 327</bibl>; Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=301" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 301</bibl> Müll.; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Aen. 12, 121</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n22699.1" n="B" level="2"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">ex avaritia erumpat audacia necesse est: inde omnia scelera gignuntur,</quote> <trans><tr>from this</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:27:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc.
