Am. 27, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde est, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22699.2" n="C" level="2"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">nati filii Duo: inde ego hunc majorem adoptavi mihi,</quote> <trans><tr>of them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Dacos et inde in Parthos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil inde (i. e. ab iis) praesidii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:1:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rege inde sumpto (i. e. ex Sabinis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:18:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 18, 5 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n22699.3" n="II" level="1"> Of time. </sense><sense id="n22699.4" n="A" level="2"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">from that time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thenceforward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">since</hi> (mostly preceded by jam): <cit><quote lang="la">suo jam inde vivere ingenio coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:36:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 36, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde durat ad nos usque vehementer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 21</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">So of time continued from a point referred to: inde ab ineunte aetate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde usque amicus fuit mihi a puero puer,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Cap. 3, 4, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam inde ab ortu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:48:124" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 48, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoad longissime potest mens mea respicere spatium praeteriti temporis . . . inde usque repetens, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 1</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n22699.5" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">after that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thereafter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thereupon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">then</hi> (cf. deinde), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:39:10" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 39, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:30:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 30, 1 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne perorandi quidem ei data est facultas: inde judicio damnatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Phoc. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exhinc Rhaeticum bellum, inde Pannonicum, inde Germanicum gessit,</quote> <trans><tr>then . . . then</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem impetu altera castra sunt adorti, inde tertia, deinceps reliqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22699.6" n="C" level="2"> With other specifications of time: <cit><quote lang="la">jam inde a principio hujus imperii, Prov. Cons. 13, 33: jam inde ab incunabulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> <cb n="INDE" /> — </sense><sense id="n22699.7" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde loci (transferred to time),</quote> <trans><tr>after that</tr>, <tr>thereupon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:789" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 789</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indebite: <entryFree id="n22700" type="main" key="inde_bi^te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indēbĭtē</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">indēbĭtō</orth>, <sense id="n22700.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>, v. indebitus <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
indebitus: <entryFree id="n22701" type="main" key="inde_bi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dēbĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22701.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is not owed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not due</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">non indebita posco,</quote> <trans><tr>I ask nothing that is not due to me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 9</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">indēbĭtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">that which is not due</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the performance</hi> or <hi rend="ital">payment of which is not due</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:6:65" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 12, 6, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 4, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:91 al" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 91 al.</bibl> —Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">indēbĭtē</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">indēbĭtō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">without just cause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unduly</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n22701.1" n="(a)" level="5"> Form indebite, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:3:5:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 22, 3, 5, § 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22701.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Form indebito, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:6:25" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 12, 6, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
indecens: <entryFree id="n22702" type="main" key="inde^cens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dĕcens</orth>, <itype>tis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22702.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unseemly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unbecoming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indecent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">improper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unsightly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ugly</hi> (post-Aug. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n22702.1" n="I" level="1"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">numquid indecens sum?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 128</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:14:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 14, 7</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n22702.2" n="II" level="1"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">nasus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:11:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:61:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 61, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">risus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:158" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est tam indecens quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 2, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. 11, 1, 82.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">indĕcenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">unbecomingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indecently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgracefully</hi> (post-Aug. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">non indecenter efferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:64" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lusca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:22:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 22, 1</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam vidi hominem beatum indecentius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 27" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 27</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intersistere indecentissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indecentia: <entryFree id="n22703" type="main" key="inde^centi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dĕcentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n22703.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unseemliness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impropriety</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:8:107" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 8, 107</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indeceo: <entryFree id="n22704" type="main" key="inde^ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dĕcĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n22704.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to misbecome;</hi> constr. with <hi rend="ital">acc. pers.</hi> (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">juvenes confusa quaedam non indecent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indeclinabilis: <entryFree id="n22705" type="main" key="inde_cli_na_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dēclīnābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22705.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inflexible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unchangeable</hi>, only in a trop. sense (postAug.). </sense><sense id="n22705.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., of things: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus animum rectum et indeclinabilem praestat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 66" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">series re rum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 2</bibl></cit>.—Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">judex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 25, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 18, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22705.2" n="II" level="1"> In gram.: nomen, <hi rend="ital">indeclinable</hi>, Diom. pp. 288, 289 P. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">indēclīnābĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">unchangeably</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 9, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
indeclinatus: <entryFree id="n22706" type="main" key="inde_cli_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dēclīnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22706.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unchanged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">constant</hi> (Ovidian). Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">qui perstas indeclinatus amico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:10:83" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 10, 83</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of things: amicitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:5:24" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 5, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indecor: <entryFree id="n22707" type="main" key="inde^cor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indĕcor</orth>, <itype>cŏris</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">indĕcŏris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-decorus</etym>, <sense id="n22707.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unbecoming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unseemly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indecorous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inglorious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgraceful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shameful</hi> (very rare; for the most part <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): cujus sit vita indecoris, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 489, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non indecorem tua te regina reliquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:845" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 845</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 679</bibl>: non erimus regno (<case>dat.</case>) indecores, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 231</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec genus indecores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:810" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 810</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">barba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
indecorabiliter: <entryFree id="n22708" type="hapax" key="inde^co^ra_bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dĕcŏrābĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>2. in-decoro</etym>, <sense id="n22708.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unbecomingly</hi>: alienos alunt, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 182</bibl> P. (Trag. Fragm. v. 258 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
indecore: <entryFree id="n22709" type="main" key="inde^co_re_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dĕcōrē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. indecorus <sense id="n22709.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
indecoris: <entryFree id="n22710" type="main" key="inde^co^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dĕcŏris</orth>, v. indecor.</entryFree>
indecoro: <entryFree id="n22711" type="main" key="inde^co^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dĕcŏro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n22711.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to disgrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disfigure</hi> (rare): me sermone indecorans, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 125, 1</bibl> (Fragm. Trag. v. 459 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">indecorant bene nata culpae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 36</bibl></cit> (al. dedecorant).</sense></entryFree>
indecorosus: <entryFree id="n22712" type="main" key="inde^co_ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dĕcōrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-decorosus</etym>, <sense id="n22712.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">disgraceful</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Hilar. in Job, 2, p. 150.</sense></entryFree>
indecorus: <entryFree id="n22713" type="main" key="inde^co_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dĕcōrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22713.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unbecoming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unseemly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indecorous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgraceful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shameful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unsightly</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quod animo magno fit, id dignum viro et decorum videtur: quod contra, id ut turpe, sic indecorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:27:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 27, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil malum nisi quod turpe, inhonestum, indecorum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:4:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indecorum est, de stillicidiis cum dicas, amplissimis verbis et locis uti communibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:21:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 21, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studia saeculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:46:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 46, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uva visu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">visus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 12, 24, § 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud indecoros motus dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">indĕcōrae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. feminae), <hi rend="ital">ill-favored women</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 10, 2</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">indĕcōrē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unbecomingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indecently</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid indecore, effeminateque faciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam minime indecore facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 31, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud indecore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indefatigabilis: <entryFree id="n22714" type="main" key="inde_fa^ti_ga_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indēfătīgābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-defatigo</etym>,<cb n="INDE" />  <sense id="n22714.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be wearied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indefatigable</hi> (post-Aug.): vigilia, Sen. de Ira, 2, 12, 7.</sense></entryFree>
indefatigatus: <entryFree id="n22715" type="main" key="inde_fa^ti_ga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dēfătīgātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-defatigo</etym>, <sense id="n22715.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unwearied</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 18:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 18, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indefectus: <entryFree id="n22716" type="main" key="inde_fectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dēfectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22716.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">undiminished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfailing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unweakened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unexhausted</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">(with aeterna) vivacitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 44, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(with jejunus) chamaeleon,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indefense: <entryFree id="n22717" type="main" key="inde_fense_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indēfensē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. indefensus <sense id="n22717.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
indefensus: <entryFree id="n22718" type="main" key="inde_fensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dēfensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22718.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unprotected</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undefended</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">Capua deserta indefensaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indefensi, inulti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 28, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inauditus et indefensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjux,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 34</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">indēfensē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">without defence</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 4, 18, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
indefesse: <entryFree id="n22719" type="main" key="inde_fesse_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indēfessē</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">indēfessim</orth>, <sense id="n22719.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>, v. indefessus <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
indefessus: <entryFree id="n22720" type="main" key="inde_fessus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dēfessus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22720.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unwearied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indefatigable</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">dextra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:651" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 651</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assiduus et indefessus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Germani ob prospera indefensi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 64</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">indēfessē</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">indēfessim</orth>, <hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unweariedly</hi> (both post-class.). </sense><sense id="n22720.1" n="(a)" level="5"> Form indefesse: <cit><quote lang="la">et benigne agere omnia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Grat. Act. 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hel. 5, 10</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n22720.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Form indefessim: <cit><quote lang="la">expetere bonorum amicitias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim. 1, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indeficiens: <entryFree id="n22721" type="main" key="inde_fi^ci^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dēfĭcĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22721.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unfailing</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">decor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 14</bibl></cit>. — <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">indēfĭcĭenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">continually</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incessantly</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 12:11" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 12, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indeficientia: <entryFree id="n22722" type="main" key="inde_fi^ci^enti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indēfĭcĭentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n22722.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unfailing supply</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Facund. Def. 4, 2.</sense></entryFree>
indefinite: <entryFree id="n22723" type="main" key="inde_fi_ni_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indēfīnītē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. indefinitus <sense id="n22723.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
indefinitus: <entryFree id="n22724" type="main" key="inde_fi_ni_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dēfīnītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22724.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">indefinite</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 4</bibl></cit>. — <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">indēfīnītē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">indefinitely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">largiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:24:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 24, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indeflebilis: <entryFree id="n22725" type="main" key="indefle_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-deflēbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22725.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not to be lamented</hi>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
indefletus: <entryFree id="n22726" type="hapax" key="indefle_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-deflētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22726.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unwept</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unlamented</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:611" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 611</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indeflexus: <entryFree id="n22727" type="main" key="indeflexus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-deflexus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22727.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unbent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unchanged</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">maturitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:4:7" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 42, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevitia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indejectus: <entryFree id="n22728" type="hapax" key="inde_jectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dējectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22728.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not thrown down</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:289" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 289</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indelassatus: <entryFree id="n22729" type="hapax" key="inde_lassa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dēlassātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22729.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unwearied</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 63</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indelebilis: <entryFree id="n22730" type="main" key="inde_le_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dēlēbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-deleo</etym>, <sense id="n22730.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">indelible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imperishable</hi> (Ovidian): <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:876" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 876</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:8:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 2, 8, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indelectatus: <entryFree id="n22731" type="hapax" key="inde_lecta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dēlectātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22731.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not delighted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">displeased</hi> with something: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquā re,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 87, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indelibatus: <entryFree id="n22732" type="main" key="inde_li_ba_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dēlībātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22732.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">untouched</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uninjured</hi> (only in the trop. signif. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">virgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:271" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 271</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:5:28" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 5, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indeliberanter: <entryFree id="n22733" type="main" key="inde_li_be^ranter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indēlībĕranter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n22733.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without reflection</hi>, Hilar. in Job, 2, p. 126.</sense></entryFree>
indeliberatus: <entryFree id="n22734" type="main" key="inde_li_be^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indēlībĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-delibero</etym>, <sense id="n22734.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not reflected on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconsiderate</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 7, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indelictus: <entryFree id="n22735" type="main" key="inde_lictus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dēlictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22735.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not criminal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">faultless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blameless</hi>, Att. ap. Fest. s. v. probrum, p. 229 Müll. (Fragm. Trag. v. 384 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
indemnatus: <entryFree id="n22736" type="main" key="indemna_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indemnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-damnatus</etym>, <sense id="n22736.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">uncondemned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unsentenced</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">indemnatus atque intestatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona indemnatorum civium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:21:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 21, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si hoc indemnato indicta causa non liceat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:56:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 56, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civem interimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:45" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 11, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:562 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 562 al.</bibl>—Com.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae pendent indemnatae pernae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indemnis: <entryFree id="n22737" type="main" key="indemnis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indemnis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-damnum</etym>, <sense id="n22737.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unhurt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uninjured</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">illaesus et indemnis evasit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. Sap. 5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Const. Sap. 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:8:9:section=4 sq" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 8, 9, § 4 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:2:23" default="NO">17, 2, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indemnitas: <entryFree id="n22738" type="main" key="indemni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indemnĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>indemnis</etym>, <sense id="n22738.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">security from damage</hi> or <hi rend="ital">loss</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indemnity</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus indemnitati consulere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:5:31" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 5, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:4:5" default="NO">12, 4, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">provinciarum indemnitati prospicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 16 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
indemonstrabilis: <entryFree id="n22739" type="main" key="inde_monstra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indēmonstrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-demonstro</etym>, <sense id="n22739.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not to be proved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undemonstrable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">modi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 3, p. 37, 9</bibl></cit>. <pb n="933" /> <cb n="INDE" /></sense></entryFree>
indemutabilis: <entryFree id="n22740" type="main" key="inde_mu_ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indēmūtābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-demuto</etym>, <sense id="n22740.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unchangeable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immutable</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Deus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Herm. 12</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">indē-mūtābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">immutably</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ennod.</author> Ep. 5, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indenuntiatus: <entryFree id="n22741" type="main" key="inde_nunti^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dēnuntĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22741.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not declared</hi> or <hi rend="ital">announced</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 5:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indepisci: <entryFree id="n22742" type="gloss" key="inde^pisci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indĕpisci</orth> <itype>assequi, adipisci</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=106" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 106</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 128, 23</bibl>.</entryFree>
indeploratus: <entryFree id="n22743" type="hapax" key="indeplo_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-deplōrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22743.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unwept</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undeplored</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:3:46" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 3, 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indepravatus: <entryFree id="n22744" type="main" key="indepra_va_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-deprāvātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22744.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">uncorrupted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undepraved</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 76:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 76, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indeprecabilis: <entryFree id="n22745" type="hapax" key="indepre^ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indeprĕcābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-deprecor</etym>, <sense id="n22745.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be averted by prayer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">poena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:13:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 13, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indeprehensibilis: <entryFree id="n22746" type="main" key="indepre^hensi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indeprĕhensĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-deprehendo</etym>, <sense id="n22746.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">undiscoverable</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">error,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pseudo</author> Quint. Decl. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 11</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Written INDEPRĔHENSĬVĬLIS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1912</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indeprensus: <entryFree id="n22747" type="main" key="indeprensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indeprensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22747.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unobserved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undiscovered</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">(with irremeabilis) error,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:591" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 591</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:565" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 565</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retinacula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Hamart. 141</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indeptare: <entryFree id="n22748" type="gloss" key="indepta_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indeptāre</orth> <itype>consequi</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=106" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 106</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
indeptus: <entryFree id="n22749" type="main" key="indeptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indeptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from indipiscor.</entryFree>
indescriptus: <entryFree id="n22750" type="main" key="indescriptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-descriptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22750.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not divided</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">vites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:21:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 21, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 2, 412</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indesertus: <entryFree id="n22751" type="hapax" key="inde_sertus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dēsertus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22751.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not deserted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unforsaken</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:9:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 9, 52</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indeses: <entryFree id="n22752" type="hapax" key="inde_se^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dēsĕs</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22752.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not inactive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">free from indolence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:22:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 22, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indesignatus: <entryFree id="n22753" type="main" key="inde_signa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dēsignātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22753.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">undesigned</hi> (late Lat.), Vict. Tunon. de Poenit. 8.</sense></entryFree>
indesinens: <entryFree id="n22754" type="main" key="inde_si^nens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indēsĭnens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-desino</etym>, <sense id="n22754.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">incessant</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Ennod.</author> Ep. 6, 10</bibl>. — <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">indēsĭnenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">incessantly</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">affero sacrificia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Ep. 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et indeficienter inhaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 12:11" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 12, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indespectus: <entryFree id="n22755" type="main" key="indespectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-despectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22755.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that one cannot look down into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfathomable</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">Tartara,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:748" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 748</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indestrictus: <entryFree id="n22756" type="hapax" key="indestrictus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-destrictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22756.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">untouched</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uninjured</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unhurt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">abibo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 92</bibl></cit> (al. indistrictus).</sense></entryFree>
indeterminabilis: <entryFree id="n22757" type="main" key="inde_termi^na_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indētermĭnābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-determino</etym>, <sense id="n22757.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be defined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indeterminable</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">quaestiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Haer. 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indeterminatus: <entryFree id="n22758" type="main" key="inde_termi^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indētermĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22758.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">undefined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unlimited</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">genealogiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Haer. 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indetonsus: <entryFree id="n22759" type="hapax" key="inde_tonsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dētonsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22759.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unshorn</hi>, = intonsus, <foreign lang="greek">akerseko/mhs,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">with unshorn hair</hi> or <hi rend="ital">beard</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thyoneus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indetribilis: <entryFree id="n22760" type="main" key="indetri_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indetrībĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-detero</etym>, <sense id="n22760.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be rubbed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">worn out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">soliditas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indetritus: <entryFree id="n22761" type="main" key="indetri_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indetrītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22761.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not worn out</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">vestimenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indevitatus: <entryFree id="n22762" type="hapax" key="inde_vi_ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indēvītātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-devito</etym>, <sense id="n22762.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unavoided</hi>, = certus, <hi rend="ital">certainly striking</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:605" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 605</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indevoratus: <entryFree id="n22763" type="spur" key="inde_vo^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indēvŏrātus</orth>, false read. for et devorato, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:20:15" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 20, 15</bibl>.</entryFree>
indevote: <entryFree id="n22764" type="main" key="inde_vo_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dēvōtē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. indevotus <sense id="n22764.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
indevotio: <entryFree id="n22765" type="main" key="inde_vo_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dēvōtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n22765.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">want of religion</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">want of principle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irreverence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irreligion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impiety</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 7, 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:9:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 9, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; Ambros. de Elia, 17, 62.</sense></entryFree>
indevotus: <entryFree id="n22766" type="hapax" key="inde_vo_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dēvōtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22766.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">irreligious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unconscientious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">donator,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 8, 55, 35</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">indēvōtē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">impiously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unconscientiously</hi>: eas (hereditates) percipere, Justin. Novell. 1, 3.</sense></entryFree>
index: <entryFree id="n22767" type="main" key="index"><orth extent="full" lang="la">index</orth>, <itype>dĭcis</itype>, <gen>com.</gen> <etym>1. indico</etym>, <sense id="n22767.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who</hi> (<hi rend="ital">that which</hi>) <hi rend="ital">points out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pointer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indicator</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n22767.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22767.2" n="A" level="2"> Of things. </sense><sense id="n22767.3" n="1" level="3"> Of <hi rend="ital">the forefinger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">index-finger.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22767.4" n="(a)" level="5"> With digitus: <cit><quote lang="la">indice monstraret digito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 11, 1, 70</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22767.5" n="(b)" level="5"> Alone: <cit><quote lang="la">sed plane pollex, non index,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:46:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 46, 1</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22767.6" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">an index</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indication</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proof</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">complexus, summae benevolentiae falsi indices in amore simulato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia continetis vocem, indicem stultitiae vestrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 6, 18</bibl></cit>: auctoris<cb n="INDI" />  anulus index, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:10:3" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 10, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimas paenitentiae indices profuderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:10:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 10, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbae horarum indices heliotropium ac lupinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 27, 67, § 252</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imago animi vultus, indices oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:18:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 18, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Janum indicem pacis bellique fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 19, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22767.7" n="B" level="2"> Of persons. </sense><sense id="n22767.8" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">one who indicates</hi> or <hi rend="ital">discloses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a discoverer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">director</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">informer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discloser</hi>, <hi rend="ital">witness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec omnia indices detulerunt, rei confessi sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sestius ab indice Cn. Nerio de ambitu est postulatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 7, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">immittere ad rei probationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 32, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idem et testis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22767.9" n="2" level="3"> Esp., in a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">an informer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">betrayer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Catilinam vallatum indicibus atque sicariis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:24:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 24, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saeptus armatis indicibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:44:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 44, 95</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vat. 10, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22767.10" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22767.11" n="A" level="2"> Of books. </sense><sense id="n22767.12" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A title</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superscription</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deceptus indicibus librorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:14:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 14, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alteri (libello) Gladius, alteri Pugio index erat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Cal. 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">index orationis P. Scipionis nomen M. Naevii habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 56</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22767.13" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An index</hi>, <hi rend="ital">catalogue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">table</hi>, <hi rend="ital">list</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non indicem certe ex bibliotheca sumptum transferre in libros suos possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:57" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 39:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 39, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:3:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 3, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hactenus omnia jura quasi per indicem tetigisse satis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:54" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi per indicem rem exponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:ib. 4:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fungar indicis partibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 5, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22767.14" n="B" level="2"> Of paintings or statues, <hi rend="ital">an inscription</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quaeris, quid quaque index sub imagine dicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:30" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabula in aedem Matris Matutae cum indice hoc posita est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 28, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22767.15" n="C" level="2"> Of <hi rend="ital">a touchstone</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in durum silicem, qui nunc quoque dicitur Index,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:706" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 706</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indi: <entryFree id="n22768" type="main" key="Indi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Indi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. Indus.</entryFree>
india: <entryFree id="n22769" type="main" key="Indi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Indĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n22769.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">India</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a country extending from the Indus to China</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:27:77 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 27, 77 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:43:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 43, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:57 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 57 al.</bibl>: citerior, <hi rend="ital">India this side of the Ganges</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulterior,</quote> <trans><tr>India beyond the Ganges</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 17, 21, § 57</bibl></cit>; Mela, 3, 7.</sense></entryFree>
indianus: <entryFree id="n22770" type="gloss" key="Indi^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Indĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>India</etym>, <sense id="n22770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Indian</hi>: ALA, Inscr. ap. Grut. 519, 7.</sense></entryFree>
indicabilis: <entryFree id="n22771" type="main" key="indi^ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indĭcābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. indico</etym>, <sense id="n22771.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that indicates</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indicative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:3:13" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 3, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indicatio: <entryFree id="n22772" type="main" key="indi^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22772.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an indicating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">setting</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">rating</hi> the valuation of a thing, <hi rend="ital">a valuation;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">value</hi>, <hi rend="ital">price</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rate</hi> (mostly ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tua merx est, tua indicatio est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 24, 50, § 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temeraria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1:13:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 1, 13, § 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indicativus: <entryFree id="n22773" type="main" key="indi^ca_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indĭcātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym> (postclass.), gram. t. t., <sense id="n22773.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">indicative</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 329</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 819</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
indicator: <entryFree id="n22774" type="main" key="indi^ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indĭcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22774.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that points out</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">naturae (al. indagator),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indicatura: <entryFree id="n22775" type="main" key="indi^ca_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indĭcātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22775.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an indicating</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rating</hi> the value of a thing; hence, <hi rend="ital">value</hi>, <hi rend="ital">price</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rate</hi>, = indicatio (Plinian): <cit><quote lang="la">neque est hodie murrhini alterius praestantior indicatura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 7, § 18</bibl></cit>: dolorum, <hi rend="ital">physicians</hi>' <hi rend="ital">fees for curing diseases</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 1, 8, § 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indicendus: <entryFree id="n22776" type="gloss" key="indi_cendus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indīcendus</orth> <foreign lang="greek">a)/lektos,</foreign> Gloss. Philox. [2. in-dīco].</entryFree>
indicens: <entryFree id="n22777" type="main" key="indi_cens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indīcens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-dīco</etym>, <sense id="n22777.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that does not say</hi>, i. q. non dicens: <cit><quote lang="la">non me indicente haec fiunt,</quote> <trans><tr>not without my telling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 62</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">me indicente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 39, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indicina: <entryFree id="n22778" type="main" key="indi^ci_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indĭcīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>index</etym>, i. q. indicium, delatio, <sense id="n22778.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a notice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">information</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summons</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">indicinae praemium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 199, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6</bibl>, p. 176, 14; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 4:28:section=4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 4, 28, § 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indicium: <entryFree id="n22779" type="main" key="indi^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indĭcĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22779.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a notice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">information</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discovery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disclosure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charge</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n22779.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">facite indicium, si quis vidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id anus mihi indicium fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 4:26:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 4, 26, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjurationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:20:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 20, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei alicujus afferre ad aliquem, Auct. Or. pro Dom. 52: deferre ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea res est Helvetiis per indicium enuntiata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convictus indicio alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 36</bibl></cit>: profiteri, <hi rend="ital">to volunteer evidence</hi> (before a court, and esp. to escape punishment by turning state's evidence): sed ipse deprehensus, multis hortantibus, indicium <cb n="INDI" /> profitetur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 35:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 35, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 16, 9</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">offerre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22779.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22779.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A permission to give evidence</hi> or <hi rend="ital">turn informer</hi> against one's accomplices: <cit><quote lang="la">Vettius reus, cum esset damnatus, erat indicium postulaturus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 24, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi indicium postulas dari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:11:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 11, 34</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n22779.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A reward for giving evidence</hi> or <hi rend="ital">informing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conscripserunt communiter edictum cum poena atque indicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:20:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 20, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vat. 11, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui indicium dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:5:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 12, 5, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22779.5" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a sign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indication</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">token</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proof</hi>: signum vocatur <foreign lang="greek">shmei=on,</foreign> quamquam id quidam indicium, quidam vestigium nominaverunt, per quod alia res intellegitur, ut per sanguinem caedes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:9:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 9, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:36" default="NO">5, 7, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">indicia et vestigia veneni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 10, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indicia atque argumenta certissima sceleris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelerum ostendere, Auct. Har. Resp. 12: parricidiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:27:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 27, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi, Auct. Cic. ap. Senat. 4: insigne meae erga te benevolentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res indicium haec facit, quo pacto, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare, i. q. ostendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=19" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 19</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">edere, the same,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:556" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 556</bibl></cit>: indicio esse, <hi rend="ital">to serve as proof</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be a proof</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de se ipse erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:prol. 4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. prol. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ei rei indicio sunt sexdecim volumina epistu larum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 16</bibl></cit>: quae domus erat ipsa indicio tui crudelissimi dominatus, Auct. Dom. 42.—With <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi, quale ingenium haberes, indicio fuit oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam vere de eo foret indicatum, oratio indicio fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lys. 3</bibl></cit>: postquam indicium est factum, dempto auro, etc., <hi rend="ital">after applying the touchstone</hi> (index), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indicivus: <entryFree id="n22780" type="main" key="indi^ci_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indĭcīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. indico</etym>, <sense id="n22780.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">indicating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indicative</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 90</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">indĭcīva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the informer</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s reward</hi>, Jul. Vict. Art. Rhet. 4, 4.</sense></entryFree>
indico: <entryFree id="n22781" type="main" key="indi^co1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (indicasso, is, for indicavero, is, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 89</bibl>), <sense id="n22781.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to point out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indicate</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n22781.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disclose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make known</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reveal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">betray.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22781.2" n="A" level="2"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">rem omnem dominae indicavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:64:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 64, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Catilina non se purgavit, sed indicavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:25:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 25, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conscios delendae tyrannidis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:22:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 22, 52</bibl></cit>: jam me vobis indicabo, <hi rend="ital">will betray</hi> or <hi rend="ital">accuse myself</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 11, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">indicabo meum consilium tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem patri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam publicae pestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de conjuratione,</quote> <trans><tr>to give information</tr>, <tr>inform</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 48:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 48, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis tibi de epistulis istis indicavit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 37, 92</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 30:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 30, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in vulgus,</quote> <trans><tr>to make publicly known</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis est actori sic indicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">rel. clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contentus indicare quid facti sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:128" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 128</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">digitis ita figuratis ut temporis et aevi (Janum) esse deum indicent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 7, 16, § 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22781.3" n="B" level="2"> Of things concr. and abstr.: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus indicat mores,</quote> <trans><tr>shows</tr>, <tr>indicates</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:94:324" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 94, 324</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimis dolorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc res ipsa indicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id esse verum parva haec fabella indicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supercilia maxime indicant factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 51, § 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut epularum sollemnium fides ac tibiae ... indicant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:51:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 51, 197</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas veterinorum indicatur dentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 64, § 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum res non gesta indicatur, sed ut sit gesta ostenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 40</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22781.4" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n22781.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To intimate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give a hint of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to state briefly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mention</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">indicare convenit, quae prodit Onesicritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 26, § 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid obiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 1, 5, § 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nominatim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 14, 15, § 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut indicavimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 115</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22781.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To set</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tell the price of</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">to value</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put a price on</hi>: hanc eme. <hi rend="ital">Do.</hi> Modo ut sciam, quanti indicet, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">indica, fac pretium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum postulasset, ut sibi fundus semel indicaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:15:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 15, 62</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22781.7" n="C" level="2"> In jurid. Lat., <hi rend="ital">to carry on a judicial process to conviction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Indicasse est detulisse, arguisse, accusasse et convicisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:197" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 197</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22782" type="main" key="indi_co2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dīco</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n22782.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imp.</hi> indice, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 132</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">indixti for indixisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:de Cels. Ep. 3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> de Cels. Ep. 3</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-dico</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to declare publicly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to proclaim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">publish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">announce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to appoint</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">totius Galliae concilium Bibracte indicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:50:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 50, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">forum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:758" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 758</bibl></cit>: Romae<pb n="934" /> <cb n="INDI" />  dierum viginti supplicatio indicitur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 90</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum in aliquem locum,</quote> <trans><tr>to order it to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of time: comitia in trinum nundinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:35:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 35, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum populo Romano suo nomine indixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 6, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=61" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 61</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">dies indicta pugnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 27, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:12:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 12, 31</bibl></cit>: familiaribus cenas, <hi rend="ital">to invite one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self as their guest</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:468" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 468</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funus,</quote> <trans><tr>to invite to a funeral</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=61" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 61</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:24:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 24, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:84" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul divom templis indicit honorem,</quote> <trans><tr>a thanksgiving</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:632" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 632</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 264</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:90" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 90</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in diem certam ut ad lucum Ferentinae conveniant indicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:50:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 50, 1</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n22782.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ipsi sibi bellum indixissent,</quote> <trans><tr>are their own enemies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:10:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophiae bellum indicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:37:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 37, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22782.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n22782.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To appoint</hi> a place of gathering, <hi rend="ital">fix</hi>, <hi rend="ital">name</hi> a destination or rendezvous: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitu indicto ad portam Esquilinam in posteram diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:22:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 22, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus omnis Aquiloniam est indictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:38:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 38, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus Pisas indictus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:41:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 41, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clam exercitu indicto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 14, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22782.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To impose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enjoin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflict</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multam,</quote> <trans><tr>to impose a penalty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 3, 3, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tributum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 60</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">servorum numerum et pondus argenti senatoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populo famem indixit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Cal. 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibimet ipse exsilium indixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:52:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 52, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: sibi patientiam, <hi rend="ital">to enjoin upon one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 123:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 123, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter ad regem Latinum Indicit primis juvenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:468" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 468</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certum dominis servorum numerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertus, cui patronus operas indicere vellet,</quote> <trans><tr>to prescribe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:162" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 162</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indicticius: <entryFree id="n22783" type="hapax" key="indicti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indictīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. indico</etym>, <sense id="n22783.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">declared</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proclaimed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">onera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 5, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
