indictio: <entryFree id="n22784" type="main" key="indicti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indictĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22784.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a declaration</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n22784.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:10:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=254:34" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 254, 34</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n22784.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n22784.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A declaration</hi> or <hi rend="ital">imposition</hi> of a tax; <hi rend="ital">an impost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tax</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:29" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:2:28" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 2, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22784.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A space of fifteen years</hi>, Cod.Th. 11, 28, 3: <cit><quote lang="la">SECVNDA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1160</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indictionalis: <entryFree id="n22785" type="main" key="indicti^o_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indictĭōnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>indictio</etym>, <sense id="n22785.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to an impost</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tax</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">augmentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indictivus: <entryFree id="n22786" type="main" key="indicti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indictīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. indico</etym>, <sense id="n22786.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">declared</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proclaimed</hi>: funus, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=106" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 106</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=160" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 160</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:7:section=42" default="NO">7, § 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indictus: <entryFree id="n22787" type="main" key="indictus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from 2. indico.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22788" type="main" key="indictus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n22788.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Not said</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unsaid</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quod dictum, indictum'st: quod modo erat ratum, irritum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae tum cecinerit, ea se nec, ut indicta sint, revocare posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 15, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tu carminibus nostris indictus abibis,</quote> <trans><tr>unsung</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:733" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 733</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicam insigne, recens, adhuc Indictum ore alio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:25:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 25, 8</bibl></cit>: indictā causā, <hi rend="ital">without a hearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unheard</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut dictator, quem vellet civium, indicta causa, impune posset occidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:15:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 15, 42</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">indicta causa in aliquem animadvertere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:17:section=43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 17, § 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:23:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 23, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:33" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 33</bibl> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi> al. — </sense><sense id="n22788.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Unspeakable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ineffable</hi> (only postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">Deum caelestem, indictum, innominabilem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 1, p. 3, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indiculum: <entryFree id="n22789" type="main" key="indi^cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indĭcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">indĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>index</etym>, <sense id="n22789.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a short list</hi> or <hi rend="ital">catalogue</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 6:49" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 6, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:7:81" default="NO">7, 81</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indicus: <entryFree id="n22790" type="main" key="Indi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Indĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>India</etym>, <sense id="n22790.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of India</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Indian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">elephanti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecudes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:37:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 37, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornu,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>ivory</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:73:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 73, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:5:80" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 5, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">margarita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 55</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Indĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">indigo</hi>, a blue pigment for dyeing and painting, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 13, 67, § 163</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:40" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 6, 26, § 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indidem: <entryFree id="n22791" type="main" key="indi^dem"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indĭdem</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>inde-idem</etym>, <sense id="n22791.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">from the same.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22791.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of place, <hi rend="ital">from the same place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos homines? indidemne Ameria, an hosce ex urbe sicarios?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:27:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 27, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thebis,</quote> <trans><tr>likewise from Thebes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex Aventino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: Megaris, Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:10:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 10, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">additi erant Bruttiorum indidem perfugae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>from the same Sicily</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hilarissimum convivam hinc indidem promam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 50</bibl>: altae renovataeque stellae atque omnis aether refundant eodem et rursum trahunt indidem, <cb n="INDI" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:46:118" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 46, 118</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n22791.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">From the same matter</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde simile duci potest (potest autem ex omnibus) indidem verbum unum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:40:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 40, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud Enni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 13</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">venena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 8, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indies: <entryFree id="n22792" type="spur" key="indi^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dĭes</orth>, <itype>for in dies</itype>, <sense id="n22792.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">from day to day;</hi> v. dies.</sense></entryFree>
indifferens: <entryFree id="n22793" type="main" key="indiffe^rens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-diffĕrens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22793.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in which there is no difference</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indifferent.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22793.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, of persons, <hi rend="ital">making no difference</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indifferent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">careless</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">circa victum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22793.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22793.3" n="A" level="2"> Philos. t. t., <hi rend="ital">neither good nor evil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not to be sought</hi> or <hi rend="ital">avoided</hi> (class.): necesse est, nec bonum esse nec malum hoc quod praepositum vel praecipuum nominamus; idque ita definimus, quod sit indifferens cum aestimatione mediocri; quod enim illi <foreign lang="greek">a)dia/foron</foreign> dicunt, id mihi ita occurrit ut indifferens dicerem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:16:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 16, 53</bibl>: nihil indifferens gloriosum est; mors autem gloriosum est; <cit><quote lang="la">ergo mors non est indifferens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 82:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 82, 10</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">indiffĕrens</orth>, <itype>ntis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a thing indifferent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neither good nor evil</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si valetudo indifferens est, bene valere indifferens est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 117:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 117, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur dolor apud Stoicos indifferens esse dicitur, non malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:5:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Zeno censuit voluptatem esse indifferens, id est neutrum, neque bonum neque malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:5:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 5, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec quae indifferentia vocamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 22:4 al" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 22, 4 al.</bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n22793.4" n="B" level="2"> In gram., of the syllaba anceps, <hi rend="ital">doubtful</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:9:48" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 9, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:93" default="NO">93</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-diffĕrenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">without distinction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indiscriminately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indifferently</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">uti utraque appellatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:6" default="NO">9, 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti his litteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:24:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 24, 8</bibl></cit>: ferre, <hi rend="ital">to bear with indifference</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unconcern;</hi> opp. graviter, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivere,</quote> <trans><tr>to eat of everything without distinction</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 122" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 122</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indifferentia: <entryFree id="n22794" type="main" key="indiffe^renti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-diffĕrentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>indifferens</etym>, <sense id="n22794.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">want of distinction</hi> or <hi rend="ital">difference</hi>, <hi rend="ital">similarity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">equivalence</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">utriusque vocabuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:3:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Didym. de Spir. Sanc. 1, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indifficulter: <entryFree id="n22795" type="main" key="indiffi^culter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-diffĭculter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n22795.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">easily</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">haurire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim. 1, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indigena: <entryFree id="n22796" type="main" key="indi^ge^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indĭgĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>indu-gigno</etym>, <sense id="n22796.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">born in a country</hi>, <hi rend="ital">native</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indigenous</hi> (class., but not in Cic. or Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">miles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fauni Nymphaeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:314" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 314</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 823</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coloni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:7:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 13, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">apri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:343" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 343</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 72</bibl></cit>. — As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">indĭgĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a native</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">majores eorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:30:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 30, 80</bibl></cit>.—Of primitive men: <cit><quote lang="la">quondam hoc indigenae vivebant more,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:38" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indigens: <entryFree id="n22797" type="main" key="indi^gens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indĭgens</orth>, entis. <sense id="n22797.0" n="I" level="1"> <pos>P. a.</pos>, from indigeo.— </sense><sense id="n22797.1" n="II" level="1"> Vid. Indigetes <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
indigentia: <entryFree id="n22798" type="main" key="indi^genti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indĭgentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>indigeo</etym>. <sense id="n22798.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Need</hi>, <hi rend="ital">want</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indigence</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">mostly Ciceron.): a natura mihi videtur potius, quam ab indigentia orta amicitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:8:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 8, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est malitia nisi indigentia boni?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> de Isaac. 7, § 60</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22798.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Insatiableness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insatiable desire</hi> (Ciceron.): <cit><quote lang="la">indigentia est libido inexplebilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:9:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indigentia, desiderium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 7, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indigenus: <entryFree id="n22799" type="hapax" key="indi^ge^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indĭgĕnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>indigena</etym>, i. q. indigena, <sense id="n22799.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">native</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vernacular</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 102</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indigeo: <entryFree id="n22800" type="main" key="indi^ge^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indĭgĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>indu-egeo</etym>, <sense id="n22800.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to need</hi>, <hi rend="ital">want</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stand in need</hi> or <hi rend="ital">want of</hi> any thing (class.). </sense><sense id="n22800.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, with <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona existimatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 15, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iis rebus, quae ad oppugnationem castrorum sunt usui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 4, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constantia inter dubia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 2</bibl></cit>, ext. 9.— </sense><sense id="n22800.2" n="II" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n22800.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To need</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be in want of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">require.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22800.4" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ingenii et virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indigeo tui consilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:35:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 35, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:14:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 14, 51</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22800.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 11, 2</bibl>; Serv. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> ad Q. Fr. 1, 3, 2</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum praesidio earum (avium) indigetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 27, 39, § 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fruges indigebant tecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12 praef" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12 praef.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">3: pax et quies bonis artibus indigent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 29</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n22800.6" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nihil,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=92" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 92</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n22800.7" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc plane indigeo discere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:1:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22800.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To long for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desire;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">non auri, non argenti, non ceterarum rerum indigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 8, 25</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">indĭgens</orth>, <cb n="INDI" /> <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">in want of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">needing</hi> any thing </sense><sense id="n22800.9" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid enim? Africanus indigens mei? minime hercle: at ne ego quidem illius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 9, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alienarum opum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,021:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Reg. 3</bibl></cit>: praesidii, Auct. B. Hisp. 17.— </sense><sense id="n22800.10" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">cotes oleo indigentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 47, § 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disceptatio multā curā indigens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 2, 13</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22800.11" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">indĭgens</orth>, <itype>ntis</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a needy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">indigent person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">indigentibus benigne facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:15:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 15, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:35:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 35, 118</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indiges: <entryFree id="n22801" type="main" key="Indi^ge^s1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Indĭgĕs</orth>, <itype>ĕtis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. Indigetes.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22802" type="hapax" key="indi^ges2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indĭges</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>indigeo</etym>, <sense id="n22802.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">needy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indigent</hi>: i. q. indigens: quem aetate exacta, indigem liberum lacerasti, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:46:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 46, 193</bibl> (Fragm. Trag. v. 328 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
indigeste: <entryFree id="n22803" type="main" key="indi_geste_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indīgestē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. indigestus, a, um, <sense id="n22803.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
indigestibilis: <entryFree id="n22804" type="main" key="indi_gesti^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indīgestĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-digero</etym>, <sense id="n22804.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">indigestible</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> de Diaet. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:9:55" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 9, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:6:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 4, 6, 90</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indigestio: <entryFree id="n22805" type="main" key="indi_gesti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dīgestĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n22805.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">indigestion</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 22, 17</bibl>; Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:146 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 146 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
indigestus: <entryFree id="n22806" type="main" key="indi_gestus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dīgestus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22806.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unarranged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confused</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n22806.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Chaos) rudis indigestaque moles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simplicitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 15, 30, § 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 10, 12, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:31:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 31, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22806.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n22806.3" n="A" level="2"> Of food, <hi rend="ital">undigested</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 53, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22806.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Suffering from indigestion</hi>, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:143" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 143</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:21:198" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 21, 198</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">indīgestē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">without arrangement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immethodically</hi>, Gell. praef. 3; Macr. S. praef. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22807" type="main" key="indi_gestus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indīgestus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>in-digero</etym>, <sense id="n22807.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">indigestion</hi>: stomachi, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:67" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 67</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indigetes: <entryFree id="n22808" type="main" key="Indi^ge^te^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Indĭgĕtĕs</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <number>plur.</number> [indu-gigno], <sense id="n22808.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">heroes elevated to the rank of gods after their death</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and regarded as the patron deities of their country</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrii Dii sunt, qui praesunt singulis civitatibus, ut Minerva Athenis, Juno Carthagini: Indigetes autem proprie sunt Dii ex hominibus facti, quasi in Diis agentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 1, 498</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dii Indigetes (in old prayer),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 9, 6</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of deified emperors, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 64</bibl>. — In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Indĭgĕs</orth>, ĕtis: <cit><quote lang="la">Indigetem Aeneam ... Deberi caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:794" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 794</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:43" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:16:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 16, 9</bibl>; in the form INDIGENS, of <hi rend="ital">Æneas</hi>, Inscr. Pompej. ap. Bull. Arch. Nap. 1845, p. 35: Indigetes dii, quorum nomina vulgari non licet, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=106" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 106</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
indigeto: <entryFree id="n22809" type="main" key="indi^ge^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indĭgĕto</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">indĭgĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n22809.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq.</hi> [2. indico], relig. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to call upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invoke</hi> a deity: <cit><quote lang="la">virgines Vestales ita indigetant, Apollo Medice, Apollo Paean,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: indigitanto imprecanto, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=114" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 114</bibl> Müll.: deam, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 4</bibl>, n. 319. — </sense><sense id="n22809.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">precem,</quote> <trans><tr>to utter</tr>, <tr>proclaim</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> de Jejun. 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indigitamenta: <entryFree id="n22810" type="main" key="indi^gi^ta_menta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indĭgĭtāmenta</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">indĭgĕt-</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number> [in-digito], <sense id="n22810.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">religious books containing the names of the gods and prescribing the mode of worshipping them</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollinis nomen Pompiliana indigitamenta nescire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 95</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 1, 21</bibl>: indigitamenta incantamenta vel indicia, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=114" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 114</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">Grannius Flaccus in libro, quem ad Caesarem de indigitamentis scriptum reiiquit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> 3, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indigito: <entryFree id="n22811" type="main" key="indi^gi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indĭgĭto</orth>, v. indigeto.</entryFree>
indignabundus: <entryFree id="n22812" type="main" key="indigna_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indignābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>indignor</etym>, <sense id="n22812.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of indignation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enraged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indignant</hi> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">illa muliebriter indignabunda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:57:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 57, 7</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with clamitans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animo irritato, indignabundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:9:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 9, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indignandus: <entryFree id="n22813" type="main" key="indignandus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indignandus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, from indignor.</entryFree>
indignans: <entryFree id="n22814" type="main" key="indignans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indignans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, from indignor.</entryFree>
indignanter: <entryFree id="n22815" type="main" key="indignanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indignanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. indignor <sense id="n22815.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
indignatio: <entryFree id="n22816" type="main" key="indigna_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indignātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>indignor</etym>, <sense id="n22816.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">displeasure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indignation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disdain.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22816.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22816.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">sive indignatione et dolore vinculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:44:2" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 44, 2</bibl></cit> (Kraner, indignitate; <cit><quote lang="la">class.): liberrima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:4:10" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erumpens animo ac pectore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:66" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus tanta exarsit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 6, § 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indignationem alicujus in se convertere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 30, 48, § 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">movere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:50:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 50, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:48:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 48, 9</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expressions of indignation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">audiebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 1, 9</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22816.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">an exciting of indignation</hi><pb n="935" /> <cb n="INDI" />  by rhetorical art: <cit><quote lang="la">indignatio est oratio, per quam conficitur, ut in aliquem hominem magnum odium, aut in rem gravis offensio concitetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:53:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 53, 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 3, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22816.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22816.5" n="A" level="2"> (<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>) <hi rend="ital">A provocation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occasion for indignation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne qua indignatio desit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:120" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 120</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22816.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A hurt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">injury to the body</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sore</hi> (only post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 14 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
indignatiuncula: <entryFree id="n22817" type="hapax" key="indigna_ti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indignātĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>indignatio</etym>, <sense id="n22817.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slight indignation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">indignatiunculam capere ... per epistulam effundere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 17, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indignativus: <entryFree id="n22818" type="hapax" key="indigna_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indignātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>indignor</etym>, <sense id="n22818.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">passionate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irascible</hi>: indignativum, quod appellant <foreign lang="greek">qumiko/n,</foreign> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indignatus: <entryFree id="n22819" type="main" key="indigna_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indignātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, from indignor.</entryFree>
indigne: <entryFree id="n22820" type="main" key="indigne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indignē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. indignus <sense id="n22820.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
indignitas: <entryFree id="n22821" type="main" key="indigni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indignĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>indignus</etym>, <sense id="n22821.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unworthiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vileness</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n22821.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid affert praeterea hominis aut dignitas aut indignitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:32:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 32, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo propter indignitatem repudiatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:19:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 19, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vat. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusatoris (as of a slave),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.— Of things, <hi rend="ital">enormity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heinousness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infamia atque indignitas rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 56</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:25:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 25, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calamitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:46:section=123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 46, § 123</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22821.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n22821.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Unworthy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">unbecoming behavior</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insulting treatment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indignity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meanness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">baseness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus adeundi et conveniendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes indignitates contumeliasque perferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indignitatibus compulsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:52:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 52, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei, foedissimae per se, adjecta indignitas est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:48:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 48, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:59:3" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 59, 3</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n22821.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Indignation</hi>, in consequence of unworthy treatment: <cit><quote lang="la">tacita esse poterit indignitas nostra?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indignitas atque ex ea ira animos cepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:45:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 45, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 7, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indigniter: <entryFree id="n22822" type="main" key="indigni^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indignĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. indignus <sense id="n22822.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
indignor: <entryFree id="n22823" type="main" key="indignor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dignor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype> (archaic <sense id="n22823.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> indignarier for indignari, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:870" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 870</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [in-dignus], <hi rend="ital">to consider as unworthy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">improper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be angry</hi> or <hi rend="ital">displeased at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be indignant</hi> (syn. stomachor). </sense><sense id="n22823.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (class.). </sense><sense id="n22823.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ipsum, Lucr. l. l.: ea, quae indignentur adversarii, tibi quoque indigna videri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:17:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 17, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suam vicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">casum insontis amici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:93 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 93 al.</bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n22823.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">indignantes milites, quod conspectum suum hostes ferre possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 19, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:651" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 651</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22823.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">si</hi>: nos homunculi indignamur, si quis nostrum interiit, Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 5, 4</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:5:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 5, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22823.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> or <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cedere peritis indignantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:604" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 604</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regem ad causam dicendam evocari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 108</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:101" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">veteri parere clienti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:64 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 64 al.</bibl></cit>— (<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <case>dat.</case> (only post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quique contaminationi non indignatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:5:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 5, 2</bibl></cit>.— (<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum ridere audientes an indignari debuerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:83" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 83</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:61" default="NO">61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:123 al" default="NO">123 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n22823.6" n="B" level="2"> Of inanim. and abstr. things: <cit><quote lang="la">(venti) indignantes Circum claustra fremunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontem indignatus Araxes,</quote> <trans><tr>disdaining to bear</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 728</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indignatum magnis stridoribus aequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 162</bibl></cit>.—*</sense><sense id="n22823.7" n="II" level="1"> In partic., of wounds, <hi rend="ital">to injure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">damage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne tumentia indignentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:3:13" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 3, 13</bibl></cit>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n22823.8" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">indignandus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">that at which one should be indignant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deserving of indignation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vestis) lecto non indignanda saligno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:660" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 660</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:547" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 547</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22823.9" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">indignans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">that cannot endure</hi> or <hi rend="ital">suffer</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">impatient</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indignant</hi> (a favorite word of Ovid): <cit><quote lang="la">genus indignantissimum servitutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbaque quaerenti satis indignantia linguae Defuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:584" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 584</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:896" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 896</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">corda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:599" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 599</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella gerunt venti, fretaque indignantia miscent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:491" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 491</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">indignanter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">indignantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with indignation</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">mussitare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferre,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indignus: <entryFree id="n22824" type="main" key="indignus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dignus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22824.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unworthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undeserving</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n22824.1" n="I" level="1"> Of persons. </sense><sense id="n22824.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">unworthy.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22824.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitias quivis quamvis indignus, habere potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:16:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 16, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indignissimi candidati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:57:11 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 57, 11 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n22824.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: te omni honore indignissimum judicat. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:16:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 16, 39</bibl>; <cb n="INDI" /> so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:23:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 23, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:90" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:1:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:304 al" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 304 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n22824.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnorum haud umquam indignus avorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:649" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 649</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22824.6" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">qui</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iine indigni erant qui impetrarent?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 41</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:27:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 27, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:4:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 4, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">indignus quem mors tam saeva maneret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:95 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 95 al.</bibl></cit>— (<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum indigni, ut a vobis redimeremur, visi simus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:59:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 59, 17</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">indigni ( = quos non decet) fraternum rumpere foedus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:111" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 111</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22824.7" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">not deserving any thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undeserving</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Indignis si male dicitur, male dictum id esse duco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad calamitates hominum indignorum (sc. istis calamitatibus) sublevandas,</quote> <trans><tr>undeservedly suffering</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:20:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 20, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeius morte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:57" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur eget indignus quisquam te divite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indignus injuriā hac,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22824.8" n="II" level="1"> Of inanim. and abstr. things. </sense><sense id="n22824.9" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Unworthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unbecoming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shameful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intolerable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cruel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harsh</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne istuc nequiquam dixeris tam indignum dictum in me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla vox est audita populi R. majestate indigna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil, quod ipsis esset indignum, committebant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lictoribus indignum in modum mulcatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indignis modis acceptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 1, 1, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exempla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid pro indignissimo habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:40:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 40, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc uno sol quicquam non vidit indignius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:8:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 8, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studiis indignum ferre laborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:17" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiemes,</quote> <trans><tr>severe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:373" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 373</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 108</bibl></cit>. — With the <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> in <hi rend="ital">u</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">digna atque indigna relatu Vociferans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:595" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 595</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:58:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 58, 4</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabula non indigna referri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:681" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 681</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:508" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 508</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">indignum est a pari vinci, aut superiore: indignius ab inferiore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 31, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non indignum videtur, egregium facinus memorare,</quote> <trans><tr>improper</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 79:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 79, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonne hoc indignissimum est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:12:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 12, 38</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">indignum, as an exclamation,</quote> <trans><tr>shame</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 1, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 22 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n22824.10" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Undeserved</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">indigna pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 30, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indignamque necem pretium patietur amoris?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:627" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 627</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Advv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">indignē</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">indignĭter</orth>. </sense><sense id="n22824.11" n="A" level="2"> Indigne. </sense><sense id="n22824.12" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Unworthily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undeservedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dishonorably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shamefully</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">indigne dotem quaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meretricem deperit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem injuria afficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervices in carcere frangebantur indignissime civium R.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:57:section=147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 57, § 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interierunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:38:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 38, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22824.13" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Indignantly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Macedones, eum sibi anteponi, indigne ferebant,</quote> <trans><tr>took it ill</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:12:section=31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 12, § 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22824.14" n="B" level="2"> Indigniter: vixit bis decem annis nata, Epigr. in <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> T. 2, p. 176</bibl> Burm.</sense></entryFree>
indigus: <entryFree id="n22825" type="main" key="indi^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indĭgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>indigeo</etym>, <sense id="n22825.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">needing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in want</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n22825.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n22825.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostrae opis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:428" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 428</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">externae opis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipendiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 40, 61, § 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rectoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 22</bibl></cit> (but <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 61</bibl>, is glossem.).—</sense><sense id="n22825.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 223</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22825.4" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauper et indigus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Silv. 3, 1, 102</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22825.5" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">desirous</hi> of something; with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">servitii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 254</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indiguus: <entryFree id="n22826" type="main" key="indi^gu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indĭgŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, i. q. indigus, <sense id="n22826.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">needing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in want</hi> (post-class.).—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 27, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">16, 196</bibl>. —With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">refectione virium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 222 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
indiligens: <entryFree id="n22827" type="main" key="indi_li^gens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dīlĭgens</orth>, <itype>tis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (class., but not in Cic.). <sense id="n22827.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">careless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heedless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">negligent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quis tractet illam indiligens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paterfamilias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 4, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 50</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si indiligentiores fuerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:71:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 71, 3</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum memoriae non indiligens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:28:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 28, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22827.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neglected</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 14, 19, § 57</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">indīlĭ-genter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">carelessly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heedlessly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">negligently</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tutari patris bene parta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil ab eo indiligenter (factum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 3, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostros praesidia indiligentius servaturos crediderant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 33, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">efferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=51" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 51</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
indiligentia: <entryFree id="n22828" type="main" key="indi_li^genti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dīlĭgentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>indiligens</etym>, <sense id="n22828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">carelessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heedlessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">negligence</hi> (class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 9</bibl>: litterarum missarum, <cb n="INDI" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:2:section=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 2, § 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aeduorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neglecta indiligentiā praedia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 4, 5, § 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veri,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>neglect of examining into the truth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 49</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indilucesco: <entryFree id="n22829" type="hapax" key="indi_lu_cesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dīlūcesco</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <sense id="n22829.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to begin to grow light</hi>: cum jam ferme dies insequens indilucesceret, Jul. Valer. Res Gest. Alex. M. 3, 42.</sense></entryFree>
indimensus: <entryFree id="n22830" type="main" key="indi_mensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dīmensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22830.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">immeasurable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">innumerable</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">populi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indimissus: <entryFree id="n22831" type="main" key="indi_missus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dīmissus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22831.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not put away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not divorced</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">uxor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indipisco: <entryFree id="n22832" type="main" key="indi^pisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indĭpisco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. indipiscor <sense id="n22832.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
indipiscor: <entryFree id="n22833" type="main" key="indi^piscor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indĭpiscor</orth>, <itype>deptus, 3</itype>, <sense id="n22833.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [indu = in-apiscor], <hi rend="ital">to obtain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reach.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22833.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (mostly ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">largiter mercedis indipiscar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitias magnas indeptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:39:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 39, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:30:12" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 30, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum in cogitando dolorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulatque hominem leti secura quies est indepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex voluit indipisci de cibo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to retain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22833.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to begin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:11:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 11, 8</bibl></cit>.?*! <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> collat. form: <orth extent="full" lang="la">indĭpisco</orth>, ĕre: <cit><quote lang="la">(occasionem) quadrigis albis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22833.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Part. perf.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">indeptus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um; <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, Cod. Th. 9, 42, 13; 12, 1, 74; and prob. also in Plin. H. N. praef. 9: honoribus indeptis, v. Sillig. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
indirectus: <entryFree id="n22834" type="spur" key="indi_rectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dīrectus</orth>, a false reading in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 2</bibl>, instead of inde recta, v. Spalding ad h. l.</entryFree>
indireptus: <entryFree id="n22835" type="hapax" key="indi_reptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dīreptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22835.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unplundered</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Capitolium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 71 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
indisciplina: <entryFree id="n22836" type="main" key="indiscipli_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-disciplīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n22836.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">want of education</hi>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
indisciplinate: <entryFree id="n22837" type="main" key="indiscipli_na_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indisciplīnātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. indisciplinatus, a, um, <sense id="n22837.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
indisciplinatio: <entryFree id="n22838" type="main" key="indiscipli_na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-disciplīnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. in-disciplina</etym>, <sense id="n22838.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">want of discipline</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 7, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indisciplinatus: <entryFree id="n22839" type="main" key="indiscipli_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-disciplīnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22839.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without discipline</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undisciplined</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Ep. 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 169" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 169</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-disciplīnātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in an undisciplined manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disorderly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqueris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Commod.</author> Instruct. 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indisciplinosus: <entryFree id="n22840" type="main" key="indiscipli_no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-disciplīnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22840.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without discipline</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undisciplined</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sir. 23, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indiscissus: <entryFree id="n22841" type="main" key="indiscissus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-discissus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22841.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not cut to pieces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undivided</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">tunica Domini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 15, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indisco: <entryFree id="n22842" type="main" key="indisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-disco</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n22842.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to learn thoroughly</hi>: magna res est posse indiscere, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:474" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 474</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indiscrete: <entryFree id="n22843" type="main" key="indiscre_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-discrētē</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-discrētim</orth>, <sense id="n22843.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>, v. indiscretus, a, um, <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
indiscretio: <entryFree id="n22844" type="main" key="indiscre_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-discrētĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n22844.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lack of discernment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indiscretion</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Didym. de Spir. S. 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indiscretus: <entryFree id="n22845" type="main" key="indiscre_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-discrētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22845.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unseparated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undivided</hi>, <hi rend="ital">closely connected</hi> (syn. indivisus; mostly post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n22845.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">agricultura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:1:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibusdam indiscretum caput, ut cancris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 46, § 129</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:84" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 29, 43, § 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suum cuique sanguinem indiscretum, sed maxime principibus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to every one those of his own blood are most inseparably united</tr>, <tr>closely connected</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 52</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">juncta ista atque indiscreta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">ita inter se conexa et indiscreta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 2</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22845.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22845.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Undistinguished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without distinction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam indiscretis his nominibus utuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multos occidere indiscretos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:26" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 26</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22845.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Undistinguishable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">imagines similitudinis indiscretae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indiscreta veri (canis) similitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 7, 17, § 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proles suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:392" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 392</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita feris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concolor exustis atque indiscretus harenis Ammodytes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:715" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 715</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut in gregibus pecudum, confusa et indiscreta omnia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Epit. 38, 3</bibl></cit>: dignitas, <hi rend="ital">alike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">equal</hi>, Cod. Th. 6, 7, 1.— </sense><sense id="n22845.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not distinguishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">random</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indiscreet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiaritas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 9</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Advv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">indiscrētē</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">indiscrē-tim</orth>, <hi rend="ital">without distinction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indiscriminately.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22845.6" n="1" level="3"> Form indiscrete (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut avium et animalium vocis edatur imitatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 65, § 174</bibl></cit>: repleta subsellia Circi, <pb n="936" /> <cb n="INDI" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Nigr. 3</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n22845.7" n="2" level="3"> Form indiscretim: ad saeculares indices debere deduci, Cod. Th. 16, 2, 47; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indiscriminabilis: <entryFree id="n22846" type="main" key="indiscri_mi^na_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-discrīmĭnābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-discrimen</etym>, <sense id="n22846.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be distinguished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undistinguishable</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim. 2, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indiscriminatim: <entryFree id="n22847" type="hapax" key="indiscri_mi^na_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-discrīmĭnātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n22847.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without distinction</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 127, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indiscussibilis: <entryFree id="n22848" type="main" key="indiscussi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-discussĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-discutio</etym>, <sense id="n22848.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is not to be discussed</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritas (al. discussibilis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim. 2, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indiscussus: <entryFree id="n22849" type="main" key="indiscussus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-discussus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22849.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not discussed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not considered</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim. 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0594,001:23:1" default="NO"><author>Nov.</author> 23, 1</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">indiscussē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">without examination</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 35" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 35</bibl>, n. 2 Mai.</sense></entryFree>
