indiserte: <entryFree id="n22850" type="main" key="indi^serte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indĭsertē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. indisertus, a, um, <sense id="n22850.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
indisertus: <entryFree id="n22851" type="main" key="indi^sertus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dĭsertus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22851.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not eloquent</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Academicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of inanim. and abstr. things: prudentia,</quote> <trans><tr>at a loss for words</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:35:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 35, 142</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">indĭsertē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">not eloquently</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">orationem non indiserte collaudavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indisjunctim: <entryFree id="n22852" type="main" key="indisjunctim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indisjunctim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>2. in-disjunctus, i. e. not separated in time</etym>, <sense id="n22852.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">immediately</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim. 1, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indispensatus: <entryFree id="n22853" type="main" key="indispensa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dispensātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-dispenso</etym>, <sense id="n22853.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not properly distributed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immoderate</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nisus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:342" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 342</bibl></cit> (cf. Drak. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:17:50:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 17, 50, 10</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
indispertibilis: <entryFree id="n22854" type="main" key="indisperti^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indispertĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-dispertio</etym>, <sense id="n22854.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">indivisible</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Mar. Merc. Cyrill. Incarn. Unigen. 25.</sense></entryFree>
indisposite: <entryFree id="n22855" type="main" key="indispo^si^te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dispŏsĭtē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. indispositus, a, um, <sense id="n22855.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
indispositus: <entryFree id="n22856" type="main" key="indispo^si^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dispŏsĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22856.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confused</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">apud Vitellium omnia indisposita, temulenta, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 68</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22856.1" n="II" level="1"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">unprepared</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Ep. 59</bibl>.— * <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dispŏsĭtē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">without order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confusedly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">moveri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 124:19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 124, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indisputabilis: <entryFree id="n22857" type="main" key="indispu^ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dispŭtābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype> <etym>2. in-disputo</etym>, <sense id="n22857.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">indisputable</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">testimonium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 12, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indissecabilis: <entryFree id="n22858" type="main" key="indisse^ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dissĕcābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-disseco</etym>, <sense id="n22858.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">indivisible</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 3, 5, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indissimilis: <entryFree id="n22859" type="hapax" key="indissi^mi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dissĭmĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22859.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not unlike</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=40" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 40</bibl> Müll. dub. (Müll. conjectures in re simili); <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Didym. de Spir. Sanc. 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indissimulabilis: <entryFree id="n22860" type="hapax" key="indissi^mu^la_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dissĭmŭlābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. indissimulo</etym>, <sense id="n22860.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be dissembled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:22:24" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 22, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indissociabilis: <entryFree id="n22861" type="main" key="indisso^ci^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dissŏcĭābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inseparable</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">unitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Opif. D. 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 14</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">indissŏcĭābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">inseparably</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim. 1, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indissocialus: <entryFree id="n22862" type="main" key="indisso^ci^a_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indissŏcĭālus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n22862.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inseparable</hi> (eccl. Lat.), (Hilar.) Anon. in Job, 1, p. 23.</sense></entryFree>
indissolubilis: <entryFree id="n22863" type="main" key="indisso^lu_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dissŏlūbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-dissolvo</etym>, <sense id="n22863.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be dissolved</hi> or <hi rend="ital">loosed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indissoluble</hi> (in Cic. only in the transf. signif.). </sense><sense id="n22863.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nodus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 24, 28, § 81</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n22863.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of persons, <hi rend="ital">indestructible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imperishable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam orti estis, immortales esse et indissolubiles non potestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:11:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 11, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Opif. D. 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 3, 6, 9</bibl>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dissŏlūbĭlĭ-ter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">indissolubly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nexum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim. 2, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indistanter: <entryFree id="n22864" type="main" key="indistanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-distanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>2. in-disto</etym> (late Lat.). <sense id="n22864.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Uninterruptedly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">syllaba uno spiritu indistanter profertur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 565</bibl></cit> P. —</sense><sense id="n22864.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Without distinction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without exception</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 9, 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">31, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indistincte: <entryFree id="n22865" type="main" key="indistincte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-distinctē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. indistinctus, a, um, <sense id="n22865.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
indistinctus: <entryFree id="n22866" type="main" key="indistinctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-distinctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (post-Aug.). <sense id="n22866.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Not properly distinguished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confused</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque inordinata, neque indistincta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 283</bibl>: cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">indistincta et confusa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:30:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 30, 5</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22866.1" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">indistinct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocabulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:20:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 20, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:30:5" default="NO">13, 30, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">defensio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 8</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22866.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Devoid of display</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unambitious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">self-restrained</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">an non in privatis et acutus et indistinctus et non super modum elatus M. Tullius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 39</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">indistinctē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n22866.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Without distinction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indiscriminately</hi>: indistincte atque promiscue annotabam, Gell. praef. § 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:8:32:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 8, 32, § 6</bibl> (for which: sine <cb n="INDO" /> distinctione, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:1:24:section=2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 5, 1, 24, § 2</bibl>) al.—</sense><sense id="n22866.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Generally</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:9:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:1:4 al" default="NO">26, 1, 4 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
indistrictus: <entryFree id="n22867" type="main" key="indistrictus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indistrictus</orth>, v. indestrictus.</entryFree>
inditus: <entryFree id="n22868" type="main" key="indi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, from indo.</entryFree>
individuitas: <entryFree id="n22869" type="main" key="indi_vi^du^i^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indīvĭdŭĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>individuus</etym>, <sense id="n22869.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">indivisibility</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">animae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrimonii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Monog. 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
individuus: <entryFree id="n22870" type="main" key="indi_vi^du^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dīvĭdŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-divido</etym>. <sense id="n22870.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">not divided</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indivisible</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <trans><tr>with stems not branched</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 30, 53, § 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille atomos, quas appellat, id est, corpora individua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:6:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil esse individuum potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:23:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 23, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpuscula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">indīvĭdŭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an atom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indivisible particle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex illis individuis, unde omnia Democritus gigni affirmat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne individuum quidem, nec quod dirimi distrahive non possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:12:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 12, 29</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22870.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">inseparable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not separated</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">comitatus virtutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 67" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 67 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contubernium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 154, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhodum secuti et apud Capreas individui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 10</bibl></cit>: pietas, <hi rend="ital">undivided</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impartial</hi>, Ps.<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 5:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 5, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indivise: <entryFree id="n22871" type="main" key="indi_vi_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indīvīsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. indivisus, a, um, <sense id="n22871.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
indivisibilis: <entryFree id="n22872" type="main" key="indi_vi_si^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indīvīsĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-divido</etym>, <sense id="n22872.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">indivisible</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">materia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 415</bibl></cit> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">anima,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 3, 5, 3</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dīvīsĭbĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">indivisibly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indivisus: <entryFree id="n22873" type="main" key="indi_vi_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dīvīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22873.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">undivided</hi> (ante-class. and post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n22873.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ungulae equorum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>not cloven</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:1:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 43, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum media indivisaque magis fratribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:312" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 312</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22873.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">common</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro indiviso,</quote> <trans><tr>in an undivided manner</tr>, <tr>in common</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 137</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(arbores) pro indiviso possessae a feris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro indiviso valere,</quote> <trans><tr>equally</tr>, <tr>in like manner</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 32, 59, § 137</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dīvīsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">undividedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in common</hi>: agere, Pseudo-Ascon. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indivulsus: <entryFree id="n22874" type="hapax" key="indi_vulsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dīvulsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22874.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not separated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">comes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indo: <entryFree id="n22875" type="main" key="indo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-do</orth>, <itype>dĭdi, dĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-, 2. do</etym>, <sense id="n22875.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to put</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">place into</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi> (mostly anteclass. and post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n22875.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22875.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coronam in focum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 143, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in urnam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 143, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignem in aram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aquam salem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vini guttam in os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 31</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22875.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">effigiem in statua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 74</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22875.4" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquid alicui</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">compedes servis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem lecticae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinclo fasciae cervicem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 57</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22875.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> only: <cit><quote lang="la">fenestras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>. — * </sense><sense id="n22875.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22875.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To introduce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">novos ritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22875.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To impart</hi> or <hi rend="ital">give to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apply to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impose on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attach to</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">pavorem suis, alacritatem hostibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odium alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui vocabulum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propterea huic urbi nomen Epidamnum inditum'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vernaculis artificibus ... nomen histrionibus inditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde Aspero inditum est cognomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:65:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 65, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:29:6" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 29, 6</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">21, 31, 4: quae nomina sceleri indidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:41:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 41, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc nomen beluis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:1:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 1, 5</bibl></cit>. — Esp., </sense><sense id="n22875.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To name after</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for</hi>: nomen indere, with <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ex</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab Erythro rege (mari) nomen est inditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:9:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 9, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a celeritate Tigri nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:9:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 9, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab inopia Egerio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:34:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 34, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod illi nomen indiderant ex nomine urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus nomen ex re inditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 78:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 78, 1</bibl></cit>. —<orth extent="full" lang="la">indĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">put</hi> or <hi rend="ital">placed into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laid</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">thrown upon.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22875.10" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum deus extrinsecus (operi suo) circumfusus sit, an toti inditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ot. Sap. 31" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ot. Sap. 31</bibl></cit> (Dial. 8, 4, 2): <cit><quote lang="la">venenum potioni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:10:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 10, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincula,</quote> <trans><tr>put on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontes,</quote> <trans><tr>thrown over</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lecticae,</quote> <trans><tr>laid upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum visceribus ustis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 585" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 585</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22875.11" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">imposed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appointed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">given</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">custodes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indocibilis: <entryFree id="n22876" type="main" key="indo^ci^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dŏcĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-doceo</etym>, <sense id="n22876.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unteachable</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Interpr. Iren. 4, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 47, § 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: indocibilis, <foreign lang="greek">dusmaqh/s,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
indocibilitas: <entryFree id="n22877" type="spur" key="indo^ci^bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dŏcĭbĭlĭtas</orth>, false reading in App. for indocilitas.</entryFree>
indocilis: <entryFree id="n22878" type="main" key="indo^ci^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dŏcĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-doceo</etym>. <sense id="n22878.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Difficult to be taught</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that cannot be taught</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indocile.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22878.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class): quia nimis indociles<cb n="INDO" />  quidam tardique sunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:5:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 5, 12</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">hebetes et indociles homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hirundines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 45, 62, § 128</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:726" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 726</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quieti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:11" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 11</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauperiem pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:539" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 539</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:310" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 310</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">teneri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:313" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 313</bibl></cit>. —Of the things to be taught: <cit><quote lang="la">sed incredibilis quaedam ingenii magnitudo non desideravit indocilem usus disciplinam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22878.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">untaught</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unlearned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ignorant</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:321" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 321</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agricola caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 25, 60, § 226</bibl></cit>.—Of inanim. and abstr. things, <hi rend="ital">untaught</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rude</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">indocili numero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:1:6" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Unapt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfit</hi> for any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores nasci alibi, quam ubi coepere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14</bibl></cit> prooem. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi> § 1.— * </sense><sense id="n22878.3" n="II" level="1"> (= non doctus.) <hi rend="ital">Untaught</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not shown</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et sciat indociles currere lympha vias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:2:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 2, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indocilitas: <entryFree id="n22879" type="main" key="indo^ci^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indŏcĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>indocilis</etym>, <sense id="n22879.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unteachableness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indocility</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2, p. 14 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
indocte: <entryFree id="n22880" type="main" key="indocte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indoctē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. indoctus <sense id="n22880.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
indoctor: <entryFree id="n22881" type="spur" key="indoctor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indoctor</orth>, <itype>false reading for inductor</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 2, 6</bibl>.</entryFree>
indoctus: <entryFree id="n22882" type="main" key="indoctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-doctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22882.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">untaught</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unlearned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uninstructed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ignorant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unskilful.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22882.1" n="I" level="1"> Of persons (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 46, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Juventius) nec indoctus, et magna cum juris civilis intellegentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:48:178" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 48, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est habitus indoctior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>. — As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">doctus indoctum superabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indocti,</quote> <trans><tr>the ignorant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 8, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:37" default="NO">4, 2, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:4" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:181" default="NO">13, 181</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Cantabrum indoctum juga ferre nostra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 6, 2</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiro haudquaquam rerum veterum indoctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pilae discive trochive,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 380</bibl></cit>. — With <case>acc.</case> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">homo pleraque alia non indoctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:10:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 10, 5</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22882.2" n="II" level="1"> Of inanimate and abstract things (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post - Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">indoctae rusticaeve manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit> Fleck. (Ritschl, moribus moris): <cit><quote lang="la">canet indoctum, i. e. sine arte, naturā tantum duce,</quote> <trans><tr>artless</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 9</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-doctē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unlearnedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ignorantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unskilfully</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">verba haud indocte fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non indocte solum, verum etiam impie facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:16:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 16, 44</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere indoctius, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:5:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 5, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indolatilis: <entryFree id="n22883" type="hapax" key="indo^la_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dŏlātĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-dolo</etym>, <sense id="n22883.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be fashioned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">formed</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">cultivated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporibus ac sensibus rigidi indolatilesque (al. indociles),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indolatus: <entryFree id="n22884" type="main" key="indo^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dŏlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22884.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not cut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unhewn</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">lapis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 253</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lignum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 196</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 98, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indolentia: <entryFree id="n22885" type="main" key="indo^lenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dŏlentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. in-doleo</etym>, <sense id="n22885.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">freedom from pain</hi> (a word made by Cicero), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:3:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 66" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 66</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22885.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Insensibility</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:6:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 6, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indoles: <entryFree id="n22886" type="main" key="indo^les"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ind-ŏles</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>indu = in-olesco; indoles, incrementum, industria, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=106" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 106</bibl> Müll.</etym>, <sense id="n22886.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inborn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">native quality</hi>, <hi rend="ital">natural quality</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nature</hi> (class.; cf. ingenium). </sense><sense id="n22886.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae indoles in savio est!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frugum pecudum, Liv 38, 17, 10: arborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 1, 16</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22886.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">native quality</hi>, <hi rend="ital">natural abilities</hi> of men, <hi rend="ital">talents</hi>, <hi rend="ital">genius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disposition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentes bonā indole praediti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:4:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 4, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutum atque vitiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">major ad virtutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:13:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 13, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">segnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclara,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescens laetae indolis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:9:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gener ob altam indolem adscitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonae animi indoles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:12:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 12, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indolesco: <entryFree id="n22887" type="main" key="indo^lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dŏlesco</orth>, <itype>lŭi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n22887.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [in-dolor], <hi rend="ital">to feel pain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to smart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ache</hi> (mostly postAug.). </sense><sense id="n22887.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus tactu indolescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi indolescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 27, § 45</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22887.2" n="b" level="4"> With <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to feel pain at</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tactum hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:13:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 13, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22887.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to feel pain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be grieved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">troubled</hi> at any thing.—Constr. with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> also with <case>abl.</case> and <case>acc.</case> </sense><sense id="n22887.4" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis (fuit), qui non indoluerit, tam sero se ... cognoscere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequari adulescentes senectae suae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">successurumque Minervae indoluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:789" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 789</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 261 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n22887.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">facto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:570" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 570</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22887.6" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: id ipsum indoluit Juno, <pb n="937" /> <cb n="INDU" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:469" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 469</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22887.7" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">indolui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:11:3" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 11, 3</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">part. fut. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">maeroris retia amicis et externis indolescenda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 12</bibl></cit>; Minuc. Fel. Octav. 5.</sense></entryFree>
indoloria: <entryFree id="n22888" type="main" key="indo^lo_ri^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dŏlōrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. in-dolor</etym>, i. q. indolentia (late Lat.; cf. Madv. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 4, 11</bibl>), <sense id="n22888.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">absence of pain</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n22889" type="main" key="indo^lo_ria2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indŏlōria</orth>, v. indolorius.</entryFree>
indoloris: <entryFree id="n22890" type="main" key="indo^lo_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dŏlōris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-dolor</etym>, <sense id="n22890.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">free from pain</hi>, Gloss. Philox: <cit><quote lang="la">indoloria medicamenta, i. q. anodyna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:4:79" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 4, 79</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indolorius: <entryFree id="n22891" type="main" key="indo^lo_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indŏlōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22891.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">painless</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Eph. 4, 17</bibl>-19.—Hence, <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">indŏlōrĭa</orth>, = anodyna, <hi rend="ital">anæsthetics</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:4:79" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 4, 79</bibl>; cf. indoloria, <foreign lang="greek">a)na/lghta,</foreign> Gloss.</sense></entryFree>
indomabilis: <entryFree id="n22892" type="main" key="indo^ma_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dŏmābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-domo</etym>, <sense id="n22892.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be broken in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tamed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">untamable</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 3, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tauri, Mythogr. Lat. 2, 136: cervix,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 10, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indominabilis: <entryFree id="n22893" type="main" key="indo^mi^na_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dŏmĭnābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-dominus</etym>, <sense id="n22893.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be mastered</hi>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
indomitabilis: <entryFree id="n22894" type="main" key="indo^mi^ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indŏmĭtābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>indomitus</etym>, <sense id="n22894.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not to be subdued</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Victor Tunon. Poenit. 30.</sense></entryFree>
indomitus: <entryFree id="n22895" type="main" key="indo^mi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dŏmĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22895.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">untamed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unsubdued</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ungoverned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unrestrained; untamable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ungovernable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fierce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wild</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n22895.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves indomitos emere,</quote> <trans><tr>unbroken</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 46, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 10</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">indomitā cervice feri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22895.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastores indomiti, spe libertatis excitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indomitae et praeferoces nationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acer et indomitus libertatisque magister,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:77" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 77</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of things concr. and abstr.: oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextra,</quote> <trans><tr>unconquered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:355" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 355</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Euri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 15, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:45" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Falernum,</quote> <trans><tr>indigestible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">licentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 24, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditates animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:14:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 14, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(with effrenata) libido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: tarditas, <hi rend="ital">invincible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that cannot be overcome</hi> or <hi rend="ital">got rid of</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 44, 69, § 171</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum,</quote> <trans><tr>uncoined</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 200</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indonatus: <entryFree id="n22896" type="main" key="indo_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dōnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22896.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without a present</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 28, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indormio: <entryFree id="n22897" type="main" key="indormi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dormĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n22897.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sleep</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fall asleep at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">over</hi> a thing; constr. with <case>dat.</case>, with <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, or with <case>abl.</case> (class. only in the trop. signif.). </sense><sense id="n22897.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">congestis undique saccis Indormis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unctis cubilibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 5, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alienis amplexibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 79</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22897.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be asleep</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be numb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torpid</hi>, of a limb, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 23, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 46, 2</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n22897.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to go to sleep over</hi> a thing, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to do it negligently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be careless about.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22897.4" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in isto homine colendo tam indormivi diu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 15, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22897.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantae causae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 12, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longae desidiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malis,</quote> <trans><tr>heedless</tr>, <tr>regardless of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:10:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 10, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indormis: <entryFree id="n22898" type="main" key="indormis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indormis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-dormio</etym>, i. q. insomnis, <sense id="n22898.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sleepless</hi>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
indotatus: <entryFree id="n22899" type="main" key="indo_ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dōtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22899.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unportioned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">portionless</hi> (class. only in the trop. signif.). </sense><sense id="n22899.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 70</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 7, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">soror,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 46</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22899.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <trans><tr>that have not received the usual honors paid to the dead</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:609" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 609</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22899.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">unadorned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus artem cum indotatam esse et incomptam videres, verborum eam dote locupletasti et ornasti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:55:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 55, 234</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indu: <entryFree id="n22900" type="main" key="indu^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indŭ</orth>, v. 1. in <sense id="n22900.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
indubie: <entryFree id="n22901" type="main" key="indu^bi^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indŭbĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. indubius <sense id="n22901.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
indubitabilis: <entryFree id="n22902" type="main" key="indu^bi^ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dŭbĭtābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-dubito</etym>, <sense id="n22902.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be doubted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indubitable</hi> (postAug. and post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:55" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:13" default="NO">4, 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:5:9:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 5, 9, § 8</bibl>,—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dŭ-bĭtābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">indubitably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without doubt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">doubtless</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 183</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indubitandus: <entryFree id="n22903" type="main" key="indu^bi^tandus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dŭbĭtandus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22903.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not to be doubted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indubitable</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">veritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 19:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 19, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indubitanter: <entryFree id="n22904" type="main" key="indu^bi^tanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dŭbĭtanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22904.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">indubitably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without doubt</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">probatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:11:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 37, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Vera Relig. 46" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Vera Relig. 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indubitate: <entryFree id="n22905" type="main" key="indu^bi^ta_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indŭbĭtātē</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">indŭbĭtātō</orth>, <sense id="n22905.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>, v. indubitatus <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
indubitatus: <entryFree id="n22906" type="main" key="indu^bi^ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dŭbĭtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22906.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">undoubted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without doubt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">certain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sure</hi> (post-Aug.): in iis ero, quae indubitata sunt, brevior, Quint. <cb n="INDU" /> 9, 4, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">litterarum inter se conjunctio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:1:1:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 27, § 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indubitatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 1, 21, § 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:1:49" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 42, 1, 49</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illius aestatis fluxus indubitatior est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:13:1:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 13, 1, § 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Advv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dŭbĭtātē</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">indŭbĭtātō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">undoubtedly.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22906.1" n="(a)" level="5"> Form indubitate (class.); <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Oros.</author> 3, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> (a false read. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:40:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 40, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:60:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 60, 4</bibl>).—* </sense><sense id="n22906.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Form indubitato, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
indubito: <entryFree id="n22907" type="main" key="indu^bi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dŭbĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n22907.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to doubt of</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>); with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viribus tuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:404" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 404</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuis moribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:5:110" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 5, 110</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
indubius: <entryFree id="n22908" type="main" key="indu^bi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dŭbĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22908.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not doubtful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">certain</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">innocentia plurimorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exempla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 24</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">indŭbĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">doubtlessly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Fragm. in Auct. Class. Tom. 3, 355</bibl> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
induciae: <entryFree id="n22909" type="main" key="indu_ci^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">indūcĭae</orth>, v. indutiae.</entryFree>
induciomarus: <entryFree id="n22910" type="main" key="Indu^ci^o^ma^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Indŭcĭŏmărus</orth>, v. Indutiomarus.</entryFree>
induco: <entryFree id="n22911" type="main" key="indu_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-dūco</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n22911.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imp.</hi> induce for induc, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:18" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 18</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">induxti for induxisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 3, 12</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">induxis for induxeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 46</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-duco</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to lead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">conduct into</hi> a place; <hi rend="ital">to lead</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bring in</hi> (class.); constr. with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case>, <case>dat.</case>, <case>acc.</case> only, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22911.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22911.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oves et armenta in rura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 3:2:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum in Macedoniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 28, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortem praetoriam in medios hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 60:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 60, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principes in cornua inducit,</quote> <trans><tr>leads against</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:34:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 34, 11</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Hannibal elephantos in primam aciem induci jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 14, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in dextrum cornu elephantos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:41:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 41, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:112 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 112 al.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n22911.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">age, moenibus induc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:326" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 326</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossā mare urbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 16</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22911.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> only: <cit><quote lang="la">princeps turmas inducit Asilas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:620" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 620</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inducunt venti nubilum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22911.5" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">eā (portā) secundae legionis principes hastatosque inducit (sc. in urbem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:15:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 15, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22911.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n22911.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bring forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhibit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">represent</hi> in the circus or on the stage: <cit><quote lang="la">a me autem gladiatorum par nobilissimum inducitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:Or. 6:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. Or. 6, 17</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elephantos in circum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 6, 6, § 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inducta est et Afranii Togata, quae Incendium inscribitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 42</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pater ille, Terenti fabula quem miserum vixisse Inducit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22911.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bring into</hi> or <hi rend="ital">before a court</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">inducta teste in senatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Firminus inductus in senatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majestatis reos in curiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22911.9" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bring home</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take into one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s family</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carasque toris inducere Thressas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:132" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra undecim dies quam illi novercam amore captus induxerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 33, 2</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22911.10" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22911.11" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To put on</hi> articles of dress: <cit><quote lang="la">si sibi calceus perperam induceretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:92" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umeros albenti amictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:2:67" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 2, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">togam super membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:387" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 387</bibl></cit>. —With Gr. <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunicāque inducitur artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:457" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 457</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22911.12" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To draw over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spread over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to overlay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overspread</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postes pice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 142</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">colorem picturae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to varnish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parieti ceram liquefactam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 7, 40, § 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuti nitorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 8, 33, § 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">varias plumas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humanam membris formam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:642" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 642</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus viris magnitudine sua inducturus caliginem,</quote> <trans><tr>to overspread with darkness</tr>, <tr>to darken</tr>, <tr>obscure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:36:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 36, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontem,</quote> <trans><tr>to throw a bridge across</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scuta ex cortice facta pellibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to cover</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coria super lateres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulvis velut nube inducta omnia inpleverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 29, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed quae mutatis inducitur tot medicaminibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:471" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 471</bibl></cit>.— With Gr. <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(victima) inducta cornibus aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 161</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 271</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22911.13" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To level</hi> the ground by filling up: <cit><quote lang="la">ita inducto solo, ut nulla vestigia exstent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 80, 82, § 194</bibl></cit>; hence, <hi rend="ital">to strike out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erase</hi>, i. e. to level the wax in writing by drawing over it the broad end of the style: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina jam facta sunt: sed vel induci, vel mutari possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus consultum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 20, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n22911.14" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22911.15" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to bring into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">introduce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditionem atque discordiam in civitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:25:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 25, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in nostros mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:28:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 28, 121</bibl></cit>: set magna<cb n="INDU" />  pars morem hunc induxerunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">morem novorum judiciorum in rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 16, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Mort. Pers. 38, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">novum verbum in linguam Latinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:19:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 19, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam in rationem,</quote> <trans><tr>to bring into</tr>, <tr>set down in an account</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:41:section=106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 41, § 106</bibl></cit>: agrum alicui pecunia ingenti, <hi rend="ital">to charge</hi> in an account, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:26:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 26, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exemplum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:6:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 6, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22911.16" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To establish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sublato judicum nomine potestas regalis inducta est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 10, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia nondum haec consuetudo erat inducta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 5 praef" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 5 praef.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">4: vetus disciplina deserta, nova inducta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22911.17" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n22911.18" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bring in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">introduce</hi> in speaking or writing (an expression borrowed from the stage): <cit><quote lang="la">hinc ille Gyges inducitur a Platone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:9:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 9, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravem personam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:15:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 15, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiresiam deplorantem caecitatem suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:39:115" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 39, 115</bibl></cit>.—Of conversation, <hi rend="ital">to introduce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puero me hic sermo inducitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 19, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc rationem Epicurus induxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:chapter=10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:23:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 23, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dubitationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 7</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22911.19" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To lead to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">into; to move</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persuade; to mislead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seduce;</hi> constr. with <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, with <case>acc.</case> or <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amici jacentem animum excitare, et inducere in spem cogitationemque meliorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:15:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 15, 59</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in spem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:15:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 15, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in rem utilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in errorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:13:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 13, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum ad aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem pretio, gratia, spe, promissis (ad parricidium),</quote> <trans><tr>to mislead</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:28:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 28, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multos in peccatum,</quote> <trans><tr>to seduce</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 19, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad maleficium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad misericordiam, ad pudendum, ad pigendum,</quote> <trans><tr>to move</tr>, <tr>excite</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:50:188" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 50, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Carthaginienses ad bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad credendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Con. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vide, quo me inducas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quos (affectus) inducendus est judex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:58" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 58</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem, ut mentiatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 16, 46</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulem promissis, sententiam promere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22911.20" n="b" level="4"> Animum or in animum, <hi rend="ital">to bring one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s mind to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to resolve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">determine; to suppose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imagine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id quod animum induxerat paulisper non tenuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 3, 8</bibl></cit>. — With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum inducere, contra ea quae a me disputantur de divinatione, dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:13:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 13, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes contemnere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:10:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 10, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id me commissurum ne animum induxeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in animum inducunt suum, Jovem se placare posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. prol. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne tute incommodam rem, ut quaequest, in animum induces pati?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oro ut ne illis animum inducas credere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 5, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui huic animum assentari induxeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 3, 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea causa causam hanc justam esse animum inducite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. prol. 41</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in animum induceret ad easdem venire epulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 18, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 17, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:18:11" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 18, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">postremo Caesar in animum induxerat, laborare, vigilare,</quote> <trans><tr>had determined</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 54:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 54, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in animum, ejus vitam defendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:30:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 30, 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 4, 5</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">quominus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inducere animum possum, ne aegre patiar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inducere animum, ut patrem esse sese, oblivisceretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:19:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 19, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in animum, quo minus illi indicarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 13, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod consules in senatu ut pronuntiarent, in animum inducere non possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 9, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 5, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 12, 3</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n22911.21" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To delude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cajole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic eos, quibus erat ignotus, decepit, fefellit, induxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">socios induxit, decepit, destituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:40:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 40, 117</bibl></cit>: semper, ut inducar, blandos offers mihi vultus <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:1" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 1</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n22911.22" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To do</hi> any thing <hi rend="ital">to</hi> one (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">injuriam adversus liberos suos testamento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:2:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-ductus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">introduced</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foreign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strange</hi> (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">insiticius et inductus sermo (opp. patrius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">nihil inductum et quasi devium loquimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 5:6:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 6, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcessita et inducta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 3:18:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 18, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
